And bless the fire on your hearth.
DivineVesselArakaali1:
There is a story held by the ancient Vaal, in which the
beautiful seductress Arakaali strode through towns, stealing
the hearts of men, and turning to ash their lovers' desires.
- "Legends of the Vaal" by Eramir, Scholar at Theopolis
DivineVesselArakaali2:
When the cold was at its strongest, Arakaali came,
and like a farmer leading cattle to the slaughter,
she drove her victims into the outer darkness.
- "Legends of the Vaal" by Eramir, Scholar at Theopolis
DivineVesselArakaali3:
Records of Arakaali's violent reign suggest she kept her citizens
sedated with 'juices of lust' and venoms of the spider. Perhaps her
guise of seductress was in fact her way of farming those 'juices'.
- "Legends of the Vaal" by Eramir, Scholar at Theopolis
DivineVesselBrineKing1:
Though his mind decayed with each passing wave,
the Brine King stood steadfast in his hatred,
and wore it like a shell, protecting himself 
from his failure to sire a worthy heir.
DivineVesselBrineKing2:
The fish-wives of Tsoatha rejoiced loudly as
the Brine King descended into the great abyss,
making merry while his blasphemous offspring
slithered 'neath the icy waters...
DivineVesselBrineKing3:
Slumbering in the breach between worlds,
the Brine King dreamt of a day he would rise,
in triumph from the shivering depths and take
back the Kingdom he once so ruthlessly culled.
DivineVesselGarukhan:
Garukhan wished once more for the skies. If she were to die,
she wanted it to be up there in the clouds. This world had never
been her home. She required greater things. She required adventure.
But die she would, here in the dirt...
DivineVesselGruthkul:
The earth shakes, moon eclipses black.
Graveyards quake, crops turn to ash,
as the grieving mother weeps.
Oceans boil and wind ravages home. 
We feel famine inside our bones,
as the grieving mother, Gruthkul weeps.
DivineVesselLunaris1:
Once beneath a moonlit sky, Lunaris bathed her child in the ocean's tide.
Though the waters were frigid with icy death, the boy was sick and
couldn't be healthy until he was silent, clean and still...
DivineVesselLunaris2:
And so it was, that Lunaris, in her compulsion to nurture and protect,
killed her son beneath the light of a waning moon. She stood silent, in
trial before her tribe, as her fiery sister fought in vain to defend her...
DivineVesselLunaris3:
But Lunaris refused to admit any wrongdoing. She'd saved her child, had she not?
He was safe now, buried beneath the dirt. Conviction gnarled around her fragile mind,
and in her pride she rose to seat a deathless throne.
DivineVesselRalakesh:
"Lock the gates and build the walls!" came the rallying cry,
"Let those of Ralakesh take care of those of Ralakesh!"
- The God Behind The Wall
DivineVesselRyslatha:
Ryslatha was flushed with pride as she watched her mindless spawn
mature. Sharpening their mandibles, her children slithered from the hive,
eager to devour all the creatures that frequented the ancient woods.
DivineVesselShakari:
"So it's true." Shakari thought, as she took her final breath.
"My father, Sin, wishes me dead. And he has sent his rabid dog to do it..."
DivineVesselSolaris1:
The mud is cracked and dry. The fields now burn beneath the blistering sun.
Even our children are dying in the streets! We've angered Solaris and so
we pay tribute to appease her fiery heart...
DivineVesselSolaris2:
When Solaris is angered, there must always be sacrifice. Our women
have taken to mourning, they drag themselves through ash and glass,
not wanting to give up our youth to the all-consuming flame.
DivineVesselSolaris3:
To take from the sun is to invite her wrath, and we've more than warranted her curse.
The granaries were vacant, so we lessened our tribute to the sun thinking it would
save our children, but they will die now regardless.
DivineVesselTukohama:
Tukohama stood in the door, blocking the sunlight
from Hikatomanga and his family. The Father of War's
retribution was inevitable, for it is known - man
cannot cheat the gods without consequence...
DivineVesselYugul:
In nature, there are many feelings exclusive only to man. But terror is not one.
Terror flourishes in our world, transcending all things. It is the bedrock on
which our great cosmos is formed. I am Yugul and I deign to understand this
mystery, to explore its depths and unlock its secrets...
DoedresMadness: "Hold your tongue before I claim it." - Doedre Darktongue
DreamFurnaceFlavourText:
The minds of men are but motes
on a sea of infinite madness.
DyingAnguish: <size:29>{Moribund, he gazed upon the journey taken as blood trickled down his chin. His eye closed on the city ahead that he would never call home.}
EarthDrinker: Taste and grow strong. Drink too much and be buried.
EmperorOfPurity:
True to his title,
Voll, newly crowned,
had many of the
Eternal Empire's signature
extravagances destroyed.
FatedUnique1:
Kaom guided his Karui across the sea
and spilled their blood on foreign soil.
FatedUnique10:
Giant's blood you cannot tame,
as wild as an unwatched flame.
FatedUnique11:
Let it pierce you, let blood flow.
Make more room for the soul to grow.
FatedUnique12: A moment of victory may last an eternity in memory.
FatedUnique13: May it echo through the halls.
FatedUnique14: What goes out must come in.
FatedUnique15: Even the mightiest tree was once just a sapling.
FatedUnique16:
Flesh may freeze and rot,
but the soul remains unbroken.
FatedUnique17: The gryphon knows only the hunt and the flight.
FatedUnique18: A burned branch leaks sap no more.
FatedUnique19_:
"The Vaal, a thousand years ago, 
came up with more delightful methods of murder
than I could ever wish for." 
- Koralus Doomfletch
FatedUnique2: For dead men require no answer.
FatedUnique21:
Where steel-grey clouds gather and crash together,
a storm is sure to follow.
FatedUnique22:
The last sweet music to touch Hrimnor's ears
passed right beneath his chin.
FatedUnique23: No one likes a quiet encore.
FatedUnique24:
"The flames are surely coming.
I just pray I am long dead before they arrive."
- Archbishop Geofri
FatedUnique25:
The soldiers stormed her throne room.
The guards held them at bay.
The peasants overwhelmed the guards.
The nobles paid for their lives.
The nobles took her throne,
and so she fled to the woods.
FatedUnique26:
"A taste of Midnight, and you may never see the dawn."
- Inquisitor Maligaro
FatedUnique27:
"At last, my beauty is beyond reproach."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
FatedUnique28:
It was Doedre who learned that pain is just
as much about fear as it is about injury.
FatedUnique29_:
You cannot control the storm,
but you can utilise it.
FatedUnique3: There is no wall thicker or stronger than fear.
FatedUnique31:
"Laws are for city folk.
Can't try a man for murder if you can't find him."
- Taruk, Last of the Wildmen
FatedUnique32:
Beneath the frozen eye of Lunaris
a new world will be born.
A crystalline, perfectly still utopia.
FatedUnique33: A single taste leaves you wanting more.
FatedUnique34:
Burning goddess, shine so bright.
Set the world 'fore you alight.
FatedUnique35:
An open mouth, a blinding shriek,
Your mind goes dark, your body weak.
FatedUnique36:
Embrace your burning ambition.
Embrace your frozen heart.
You will be transformed.
FatedUnique37:
"Even for the great Magi,
time passes without relent."
- Doryani, Queen's Thaumaturgist
FatedUnique38:
"The most dizzying heights are surrounded by precipitous falls.
Progress cannot be eternal."
- Doryani of the Vaal
FatedUnique39:
"Cut down the tallest tree,
and another becomes the tallest."
- Old Ezomyte saying
FatedUnique4:
The Karui boats were closing the gap,
but Shavronne had laid for them one final trap.
FatedUnique40:
Follow your most basic instincts.
The rest will come naturally.
FatedUnique41:
Asenath loosed arrows with almost musical rhythm,
a rhythm matched by her nearly inaudible whispers,
and the crunch of the dead hitting the dust.
FatedUnique42:
"Make a man believe he is doing the world a good deed,
and there is nothing you can't make him do."
- Malachai, the Soulless
FatedUnique43:
There is no cost too great to pay for power.
Merely men who lack the conviction to pay it.
FatedUnique44: The breath of life is theirs to take.
FatedUnique45:
By light we are shadowed,
in darkness we are bound.
FatedUnique46:
Few men command an army better
than the Great Meginord of the North
FatedUnique47:
Few men can guide their people
like the Great Meginord of the North
FatedUnique49:
Hyrri's quick thinking led to victory,
but it came at the cost of respect.
FatedUnique5:
The overture stretches thin,
The chorus gathers to begin.
Stacatto, drone, a rest drawn long,
Another hears Death's final song.
FatedUnique50:
Make a man hot, and his heart will skip a beat.
Set a man on fire, and his heart will skip all beats.
FatedUnique51:
The night dances on
Wine continues to flow
Your skin looking pale
Your soul letting go
FatedUnique52:
"Confess your sins to me. My god will not be nearly so forgiving."
- Archbishop Geofri of Phrecia Cathedral
FatedUnique53:
"Please, take whatever you want. Just don't kill me"
"But then I wouldn't have everything I want, would I?"
FatedUnique54: As death arrives, so too does instinct.
FatedUnique55:
Legend tells of a time when Solaris will
burst forth from Lunaris,
and night will be eternally banished.
FatedUnique56:
One more partner by the hand,
Let your steps entwine.
Spin together, swing as one,
And dance with death in trine.
FatedUnique57:
"Stand steadfast in the face of destruction.
The Council cannot afford to falter."
- Mauritius, the Iron Heart
FatedUnique58:
The weight of faith is great
Yet it is never borne alone.
FatedUnique59_:
Even the dead dare not
trespass into Ullr's dominion.
FatedUnique6: Nothing spreads fear faster than the unknown.
FatedUnique60:
"Though Geofri's beacon was extinguished,
his embers may yet light our way."
- Victario, The People's Poet
FatedUnique61: As you guided me, now I guide others.
FatedUnique7: The largest rock leaves the deepest mark.
FatedUnique8:
Fire spreads thick and fast.
The first spark is never the last.
FatedUnique9:
Flames to guide the Great Spirit to the site of the dead,
and smoke to carry them into the sky.
Faustus1:
"Darnaw is stupid and confident.
I am certain he will have recorded his misdeeds."
Faustus2:
"Fidium's fealty to fairness 
makes him the perfect pawn in my plan.
Our plan. Perfect pawn in OUR plan."
ForbiddenPower: Some things should not be used. Some power is too great a risk.
GemcuttersPromise: <size:29>{"I swore to use my position to help the people. What good is power when it just accumulates on the already-powerful?" - Erasmus, Imperial Gemcutter}
GiftOfTheGemlingQueen:
Our Lady Dialla,
as a symbol of our progress,
shines greater than all the gems.
GlimmerOfHope: When you dwell in total darkness, even the faintest light may guide you out.
GraspingMailFlavourText:
Of ash and avalanche,
in storm and flesh,
we dream of unity.
The time approaches...
GraveKnowledge: The dead tell me great insights. They've had nothing but time to sit and think.
HarmonyOfSouls:
<size:29>{Shrieking souls locked away 
Hate splits frozen cells asunder 
The knot of corruption
undone at last}
HeistAbberathine Horns:
"As warm as living flesh, and smelling strongly of sulphite.
Morbid curiosity compels me to add it to my collection of oddities."
HeistAdiyah1:
"When hope was but a memory, the twin sister Sekhemas Solerai and Lundara arose to unite the Maraketh.
They wielded the essence of gold and silver. The Spear is one of the two weapons that forged us."
HeistAdiyah2:
"Wraeclast is harsh, and the Plains of Vastiri are unforgiving. We Maraketh can
ill afford an internal war. We must prove that Nashta is behind these attacks."
HeistAdmiralProclarsPipe:
"Admiral Proclar wreaked havoc on my smuggling routes for two full decades. Now that he's dead, 
it's a matter of thieves' honour to check whether my product was in his pipe."
HeistAlchemicalChalice:
"The chalice holds certain properties that make scientists quite possessive and irrational.
It's best if you don't ask too many questions about this one."
HeistAncientSeal:
"At first glance, this seal seems no more than an ornament. But when one
looks closer, one realizes the design is from no culture we yet know of."
HeistBloodOfInnocence:
"In the early days of his religion, Innocence told his followers to drink of his blood and
enjoy eternal life. If that power holds in his ancient ichor, I hope that it can resurrect as well."
HeistBoxofTripyxis:
"Allegedly turns water to Lethe. That makes it my competition. 
I don't like competition."
HeistCelestialStone:
"This unassuming rock reportedly fell from the sky a few centuries ago. Sounds impossible,
but the men who are guarding it obviously believe the tale, so I do, too."
HeistCrestofEzomyr:
"A symbol of my birthright and claim to my fiefdom. 
I must have it if I am to return my family to its rightful place."
HeistDekharasResolve:
"A simple ornament from the days when Keth's trade empire was the
glory of the world. Protectors at the massive toll gates wore these."
HeistEldritchBlade:
"The Eldritch Blade is one half of a pair. Together, the two are said to drive men
insane by revealing the truth of the world to them. I wish to know this truth."
HeistEmperorCaspiro:
"Caspiro was a master of presentation. He maintained peace in Wraeclast through displays
of strength that, sadly, had no meaning to the dark presence that dismembered him..."
HeistEnigmaticAssemblyA:
"I currently possess four-hundred and forty-four pieces of this ancient
and puzzling device. A few seem to be missing. This part is crucial."
HeistEnigmaticAssemblyB:
"There is no telling what this device may do when completed, but I
have made it my life's work. There must be a deeper meaning!"
HeistEnigmaticAssemblyC:
"I have spent my family's entire fortune in the pursuit of this device.
Assembling it and turning it on is all I have left."
HeistEnigmaticAssemblyD:
"My schematics are clear. Once the Enigmatic Assembly is complete, it
will be a weapon to rival the gods! It must be... it has to be..."
HeistEssenceBurner:
"Trust in scientists to create tools for better drug distillation. They don't know the
worth of the beautiful tools they have. Let's make sure it stays that way."
HeistEzMyraeTome:
"A true curiosity. Matches no known language, yet its illustrations hint at knowledge 
only rediscovered hundreds of years after the death of its unknown author."
HeistFlaskOfWelakath:
"Long ago, a traitor was promised this mythical elixir. We consider her a fool for
believing it exists, but if it does... I would certainly like to take a sip and find out."
HeistForbiddenLamp:
"The lamp is said to contain Aziza, the Fourth Servant of Water. I doubt the tale
is true, but I cannot allow one of our artifacts to fall into Kondor's hands."
HeistGianna1:
"I heard the script will send any who attempt to perform it mad,
but that other than that, it is very good."
HeistGianna2:
"Make sure it'll fit a small man, or a very large child.
And check for stains! Knew a few people who'd use them for-... 
...Just check for stains."
HeistGoddessOfWater:
"The relief depicts some sort of forgotten Maraketh goddess. I have no idea what
the context is. The important thing is that you steal it before Bazira does."
HeistGoldenIdol1:
"I found the tomb in the first place, and they had the nerve to empty it without me! 
Reckon it'll make a fine trophy for my efforts."
HeistGoldenIdol10: The last shimmering face witnessed by many a sacrifice.
HeistGoldenIdol11: Silently keeps innumerable secrets whispered in moments of desperation.
HeistGoldenIdol12: At once horrid and beautiful, awkward and alluring, silly and overwhelmingly mysterious.
HeistGoldenIdol13: Dried blood remains trapped in its many deep grooves.
HeistGoldenIdol2:
"One must, as one should, admire the lasting works of those who came before.
The Vaal were the uncontested greatest architects until we,
and Matatl soared above their best."
HeistGoldenIdol3:
"I believe she was a beautiful maiden. 
Kind, virtuous and devout through-and-through.
Such a gift will set me apart from all other suitors."
HeistGoldenIdol4:
"Victims of war, the indebted, and the irredeemably shamed
were to live their lives in servitude. Some rose above their station. 
This individual, it seems, was all but deified."
HeistGoldenIdol5:
"Heard if you put a drop of blood in its mouth,
it'll whisper the secrets of immortality.
Doesn't have to be your own blood, does it?"
HeistGoldenIdol6:
"I'll give it to her and tell her
'It once held the reflection of a Queen, and now it will once more.'
Anton can cross the Vastiri on his family fruits 
if he thinks he loves her like I do."
HeistGoldenIdol7_: Once cast the reflections of royalty, now worth the sum of its parts.
HeistGoldenIdol8: Ornately adorned and heavier than is practical.
HeistGoldenIdol9: A common figure adorning Vaal ruins, but exquisitely crafted from gold.
HeistGoldenToucan:
"It is said that the Golden Ibis was forged before time itself, before writing, or even
oral history. That's nonsense, of course, but it's still very old, and therefore noteworthy."
HeistHandofArimor:
"Balabus Arimor was a little-known preacher during the days of Emperor Chitus,
who believed eternal life could be achieved through ritual sacrifice.
We shall see whether he was a prophet - or a charlatan."
HeistHeartCoil:
"There are very few devices in this world that can act as a heart for a
machine. This one is an ancient remnant of the work of Vaal engineers."
HeistHuck1:
"Lost touch with a mate of mine when
he got recruited into some secret squad.
Just want to see how he's doing."
HeistHuck2:
"Enoch deserved better. 
This is the least I can do."
HeistImpossibleCrystal:
"The world is governed by certain natural laws. Science and thaumaturgy are one
and the same. But the crystal... it shouldn't exist. It's not from here. We must have it."
HeistIncenseofKeth:
"Sap of the Aturi tree, known only to grow at the meeting point of the seven waters.
Nothing since its disappearance has smelled as wondrous."
HeistIsla1: My inventions, my babies, deserve to be in better hands!
HeistIsla2:
...the blueprints for my Extreme Warmth Beam, my Storm Wooing Rod,
the Mind Sublimator, and the Unbreakable...!
HeistKarst1:
"They were me granddaddy's. 
Could break into any house as quick and silent as a Cardinal's fart."
HeistKarst2:
"Traitorous scum took the life I could've had. 
I ain't usually the forgiving type, 
but I feel in this case that I owe him a little gift."
HeistKarst3_: "Never take credit for another man's work."
HeistLivingIce:
"Are we the only ones who understand the danger? The fools! Living ice absorbs heat
and grows. We must control it properly, lest it spread across all of Wraeclast."
HeistNenet1:
"If we can prove Jamanra existed, then the Faridun may have a chance to rejoin the
Maraketh. I, for one, would like to meet my parents. I have many questions..."
HeistNiles1:
"There is nothing quite so exquisite as a forced confession. The sufferer will
say anything to make the pain stop, and that's the point. Guilt is irrelevant."
HeistNiles2:
"It supposedly causes enormous plants to grow from almost any soil. The myth claims we
need to sacrifice a baby to make it function, but that's a bit grotesque, even for me."
HeistOghamCandelabra:
"Those Eternal bastards looted everything that wasn't bolted to the floor when we
finally drove them from our island! That candelabra belongs with us!"
HeistOrbalasFifthAdventure:
"The relief was the first ever depiction of some Maraketh girl named Orbala undertaking her
fifth great adventure. I don't particularly care about the story, I just don't want Bazira to have it."
HeistSeaPearlHeirloom:
"My accursed father owes his children this heirloom. We deserve
to know our culture, just like you full-blooded humans do."
HeistSealOfLunaris:
"I have a suspicion that the Maraketh Sekhema of legend, Lundara, is the same historical
figure as the Azmeri and Eternal goddess Lunaris. The Seal may prove that."
HeistSealOfSolaris:
"It is my belief that Solerai, from the Maraketh legend, is Solaris herself in another system of
myths. If I can prove that, I can begin piecing together a true history of the Winter of the World."
HeistStaffOfTheFirstSinEater:
"The history of the order of Sin Eaters is shrouded in secrecy and shame.
Nevertheless, history demands truth, even if it takes centuries to be revealed."
HeistSwordOfTheInverseRelic:
"By all accounts, the Sword of the Inverse Relic was found aged and rusted,
but is becoming less weathered over time. We really must study its properties."
HeistTibbs1:
"Loved her like she was my own daughter.
I just want to know she's safe."
HeistTibbs2:
"Damn near everything I've earned. 
Worth every little bit."
HeistTullina1: "Let's just hope she wasn't wearing it when she wandered into the sea!"
HeistTullina2: "It isn't fair to either of us to keep chasing this dream."
HeistTuskedHominidSkull:
"If the skull is real, and not a forgery, then it may show that my people are not the
abominations others believe us to be. The word 'human' may have a broader meaning."
HeistUrnOfFarud:
"The Faridun cannot earn burial in the sky.
They have other ways of keeping the dead."
HeistUrnOfTheOriginalAshes:
"A great fire once swept the land, and our leaders were turned to ash where they stood.
The urn contains exactly what you think it does, and serves as proof of our long lineage."
HeistVinderi1:
"Just the usual highly-illegal compounds.
Don't drop them. It's fine if you do, but don't."
HeistVinderi2:
"I wish I could say this was the first time I've forgotten to restock on this thing. 
I forget what it was, but I'm sure I'll remember by the time we need to get it.
Was it beetles? Bottles? I think it began with 'B'.
Or it had no 'B'."
HerMask:
To her beauty you submit,
lest your neck the great Queen slit.
Heterochromia:
<size:26>{Black and White, Silver and Gold
Let us see the world Unfold
Red and Blue, Yellow and Green
Let us remake it in colours Unseen}
Hope: <size:31>{The others succumbed to madness and depravity, but Lori fought on. Alone in the darkness, she could still see the dull light of hope's distant dawn.}
HouseOfMirrors: What do you see in the mirror?
Hubris:
"This one? It is NOT for sale. You would sooner pry it from my lifeless hand."
- Jonfé Darontos, Ringmaker
HuntersResolve:
Primed, curved and sleek.
Decisive and final.
For malice and righteousness.
There's but one solution.
HuntersReward: To tame a beast, you first must subdue its heart.
ImmortalResolve: The threads of fate are the strongest ties.
IncursionItemisedTempleDefault: "Grand plans were laid for a place called Atzoatl, though fierce bickering between its Architects is said to have stifled its development." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Research Report
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Armour: "Armour crafted at Atzoatl became the envy of the known world." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Ancient Metals
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Atziri: "Evidence suggests that Atzoatl's influence grew great enough that Atziri herself moved her seat of power to within its walls." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Royal Decree cast in Bronze
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Breach: "Atzoatl played host to the Cult of the Purple Flame. I do not know what powers they worshipped, but my educated guesses leave me shaken." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Embalmed Claw
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Corruption: "Atzoatl was a locus of Corruption, a temple dedicated to the worship of the unspeakable." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Eroded Vaal Orb
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Currency: "In their paranoia, the Architects of Atzoatl hoarded wealth beyond any reasonable measure." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Vaal Golden Idol
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Damage: "At the height of their civilization, the Vaal took to ritual combat to solve all of their disputes. As a result, their surviving warriors were among the best in history." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Rust-coated Sword
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Explosives: "Atzoatl was a place of crude alchemy rather than art." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Urn of Unstable Powder
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Fire: "The Vaal were said to have experimented with fire at Atzoatl, though to what end is unknown." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Charred Parchment
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Gem: "Doryani himself conducted gem research at Atzoatl in its final days. What brilliant discoveries were lost with that temple?" - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Third Ciphered Tablet
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Ghost: "The Architects were certainly fond of their ghost stories. The tales almost sound as if the business was taken literally." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Carved Fable
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Hatchery: "A great many creatures were bred at Atzoatl, ostensibly due to repeated invasion by some kind of horrifying murderous entity." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Fossilized Egg Sac
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Jewellery: "Trade with lesser cultures, such as the Maraketh and the early Karui, resulted in overflowing vaults full of golden trinkets and elegant jewels." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, 'Dekhara's Resolve'
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Legion: "The Architects intended to research supposed 'Obelisks Beyond Time,' but the Vaal fell before the first obtained monolith was so much as measured." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Crystal Shard
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Lightning_: "The Architects apparently sought to master lightning. They may have succeeded just before the fall." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Copper Detritus
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Map: "In its last days, the Architects of Atzoatl became increasingly obsessed with fictional lands. Wondrous lands, by their description, but fictional. Very odd." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Unidentified Angular Device
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Museum: "Much could be learned from the relics said to be kept in Atzoatl. We consider the Vaal ancient, so what did they consider ancient in turn?" - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Vaal Mural
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Nexus: "The heart of Atzoatl imbued its denizens with vigour, according to the myths." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Glowing Stone
IncursionItemisedTempleT3PackSize: "A great many warriors were stationed at Atzoatl, ostensibly due to repeated invasion by something referred to as 'a haunting death.'" - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Carved Interment Records
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Poison: "The Vaal had little concern for the externalities of their engineering. The toxins produced by their manufacturing may have poisoned the entirety of Atzoatl." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Desiccated Corpse of a Vaal Citizen
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Restoration: "The Architects sought immortality... perhaps they reside within Atzoatl still..." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Vial of Emerald Water
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Sacrifice: "When the Vaal discovered power could be gained from sacrificing the living, Atzoatl became a death march for the lower classes." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Obsidian Sacrificial Knife
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Strongbox: "Zantipi is said to have spent most of his considerable talent devising ambushes that used the promise of treasure as a lure for would-be looters." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Broken Locking Mechanism
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Tempest: "Merchant carvings of the era consistently reported that the Architects could alter the weather in manners terrifying and incomprehensible." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Trade Record Tablet
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Trap: "Expedition logs suggest quite a few explorers sought Atzoatl over the centuries. The Architects planned against this potential plundering, however, with ingenious and lethal traps." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Corroded Spring Mechanism
IncursionItemisedTempleT3Workshop: "Their engineering knowledge may have rivaled that of the modern world. The fall of the Vaal no doubt set humanity back a thousand years." - Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Ancient Gear Interlock
IncursionVialBossAmulet: Festivities of blood. Bleeding hearts and screaming lungs.
IncursionVialBossFlask:
With great tragedy and power,
the dead are netted in anguish.
IncursionVialBossJewel:
It is not our flesh, our thoughts, or our soul that limits us;
it is the distinction between them.
IncursionVialFire:
Ancient myths of flame, frost and thunder.
Will we ever know the way forward?
IncursionVialHealing: Call to place the demon gods of the past.
IncursionVialLightning:
The ritual creates order. 
Both in the minds of men and gods. 
The ritual creates order.
IncursionVialMinion:
Your actions live but a moment;
their repercussions never die.
IncursionVialPoison: The eyes of Apep flicker open and the Poisoned One stirs.
IncursionVialTrap:
Blood, slaves and stone.
The timeless edifice of Dominance.
JackInTheBox:
Turn the crank, 
close your eyes, 
and pray to the gods 
for a pleasant surprise.
KeybladeText: Forged from thousands of unclaimed Beta keys
Kurai1:
"A symbolic piece of history,
from a time when people of all backgrounds
united against a common enemy."
Kurai3:
"I won't be bullied.
We must get Hana back."
LabyrinthBaneOfTheLoyal:
A snake cannot survive without its head.
But neither can the head survive without the body.
LabyrinthCogsOfDisruption:
Take a cog here, place a cog there,
and the great machine grinds to a halt.
LabyrinthCubeOfAbsorption: Beware the one who seeks to contain a storm.
LabyrinthHeartOfTheGargoyle:
All living things need a heart,
even those made of stone.
No heart, no life.
LabyrinthOrbOfElementalEssence: Return Nature's gift to the source.
LabyrinthPortalShredder:
The best way to keep out an unwanted guest
Is to simply close the door.
LabyrinthRodOfDetonation: What can be built, can be destroyed.
LabyrinthSandOfEternity: That which takes an eternity does not happen.
LantadorsLostLove:
<smaller>{They fought the storm together as one, 
Until the longest of days was done. 
Their love grew stronger
with every breath, 
Until it was broken apart in death.}
LastHope: <size:31>{As their civilisation crumbled, the Vaal looked to their queen. In her, they saw a way out. In them, she saw a burden she was happy to free herself from.}
LeftToFate:
<size:30>{Many strive for greatness,
but it is challenge, unforeseen,
that forges heroes.}
LightAndTruth:
Time and change
shall naught avail,
To dim the Light
of Truth's fair grail.
LingeringRemnants:
Never dying, yet not living,
Endlessly they wander
beneath the harvest moon.
LostWorlds:
<size:27>{"There are worlds that lie beyond the edge of my page, the edge of my understanding. Worlds of wonder. Worlds of terror."
Aramil - Cartographer to Emperor Chitus}
Loyalty:
Bound by fate,
inseparable by choice.
LuckOfTheVaal:
They can't be THAT lucky,
or they'd still be here!
LuckyConnections: Luck is a fool's game, and I know plenty of rich fools.
LuckyDeck: When the outcome is the same, does it matter if it is fortune or trickery?
LysahsRespite:
So many memories,
so much pain in
such a small token.
Drown it in blood
so you can forget.
MapWorldsAcademy:
They came for enlightenment,
but were imprisoned by madness.
MapWorldsAcidLakes:
Clear water springs forth.
A moment of purity before it too gathers filth.
MapWorldsAlleyways:
An unwashed gutter, where wretches
cut purses and throats alike.
MapWorldsAncientCity:
This was not the first
civilization to believe itself
the greatest. And it will
not be the last.
MapWorldsArachnidNest:
Man is not the only beast to
bend nature to its will.
MapWorldsArachnidTomb:
They feel your every move,
your every breath,
with a million little wires.
MapWorldsArcade:
We create so that some part
of us may remain after death.
MapWorldsArena:
The sound of a thousand calls
for blood echo for eternity.
MapWorldsAridLake:
Water vanishes; an impromptu
prison becomes a tomb.
MapWorldsArmoury:
There is no war. There is no army.
Only fear lingers.
MapWorldsArsenal:
There is no war. There is no army.
Only rage lingers.
MapWorldsAshenWood:
Desperately reaching skyward
and digging downwards.
Sustenance is an
eternal struggle.
MapWorldsAtoll:
Time turns even the vicious
volcanoes to hollow shells.
MapWorldsAtollUnique:
Whispers from
a world apart
Speak my name
beyond the tomb;
Bound within
the Maelström's heart,
Will they grant me
strength or doom?
MapWorldsBarrows:
Man burrows for only
the eternal hibernation.
MapWorldsBasilica:
Built so the prayers would echo.
A resonance no god could hear.
MapWorldsBazaar: Greed is the only god here.
MapWorldsBeach:
A paradise, forever replenished by
endless waves teeming with life.
MapWorldsBelfry:
Bells are rung in celebration, and in sorrow.
And, finally, in despair.
MapWorldsBog:
Layer upon layer of death and rot.
Disgusting.
MapWorldsBoneCrypt:
The dead ask to be remembered,
but such requests
are seldom met.
MapWorldsBoneCryptUnique:
They flew, and leapt,
and clambered over,
They crawled, and swam,
and slithered under.
Still its ancient secrets
await unclaimed
And of this hidden temple,
only legends remain.
MapWorldsBramblefall:
The faintest traces of civilisation
defiantly resist nature's scouring tendrils.
An admirable, but futile, effort.
MapWorldsBurialChambers:
Vile fiends hide beneath
the peaceful plains.
MapWorldsBurn:
Does the land reject the dead,
or do the dead reject their fate?
MapWorldsCage:
Treat a man like a wild animal,
and he will soon learn to bite.
MapWorldsCaldera:
From the heart of fire, rivers
of burning rage billow forth.
MapWorldsCanyon:
A deep wound in the land.
One that will never heal.
MapWorldsCarcass:
Life's wet, reproductive stink abates,
relenting to death's chaste ritual of decay.
MapWorldsCastleRuins:
When the castle falls,
it has failed its only purpose.
MapWorldsCells:
Life crushed together.
Left to crumble to dust.
MapWorldsCemetery: A stone forest of forgotten names.
MapWorldsCemeteryUnique:
Some dead have long
envied the living.
When given the chance,
they take from us what they can.
So we offer our suffrage.
In return, they give
only suffering.
MapWorldsChannel:
The stone cannot stop the torrent.
It can only divert it.
MapWorldsChateau: Beauty and brutality in such close proximity.
MapWorldsChateauUnique:
Forget kings and emperors;
He who holds the coin holds all the power.
MapWorldsChimera:
One of my captors hid a beast within his heart.
Now his true self can be seen by all.
MapWorldsCitySquare:
Countless generations have
walked these time-worn stones.
MapWorldsColdRiver:
Ice forges a fickle path,
as those beneath its veil can attest.
MapWorldsColonnade:
Small minds demand
the largest structures.
MapWorldsColosseum:
Life means as little as a passing
moment of entertainment.
Let them rot.
MapWorldsConservatory:
Ornate, elaborate, ostentatious...
and dripping with death.
MapWorldsCoralRuins:
Thrust above the waves, still teeming
with horrors from the depths.
MapWorldsCore:
Black monstrous bridges cross oily rivers,
leading nowhere. Nothing as it should be.
MapWorldsCourthouse:
Justice born of love is a surrender.
Justice born of law is a punishment.
MapWorldsCourtyard:
An elaborate, beautiful garden,
hidden from the public. Selfish.
MapWorldsCourtyardUnique:
To the east, 
it cannot be seen.
To the west, 
it cannot be touched.
To the south, 
it cannot be remembered.
And to the north, 
it cannot be contained.
MapWorldsCoves:
The dark seas swallow the careless
and spit them against sharp rocks.
MapWorldsCrimsonTemple: A sanguine supplication to death and depravity.
MapWorldsCrimsonTownship:
Rain will wash away the stains,
but the madness and memories will never fade.
MapWorldsCrystalOre_:
As the torch flickers, brilliance
emerges in boundless variance.
MapWorldsCursedCrypt:
Saints and heathens look the same
once the rot takes hold.
MapWorldsCursedCryptUnique:
For his sins
he was hunted in his sleep,
judgement wrought
of twisted nightmare.
The Coward bound
his dreams to stone,
awaiting another to walk
the path of true atonement.
MapWorldsDarkForest:
The trees grow twisted and gnarled,
without a hint of light.
A curse lingers here.
MapWorldsDefiledCathedral:
Crafted with reverence.
Defiled with ease.
MapWorldsDesert:
Heat. Dust. Wind. These are what
forge strong minds and bodies.
MapWorldsDesertSpring:
As mirage becomes reality,
hardship is briefly quenched.
MapWorldsDig:
A hollow echo of bygone times
in a land where none lived long.
MapWorldsDrySea:
Where once waves crashed with crushing force,
brittle wooden bones tell tall tales.
MapWorldsDunes:
Shifting, morphing, expanding. A reminder
of the virtues of an agile mind.
MapWorldsDungeon:
A penitentiary for those who are not penitent
is nothing more than an inn for the evil.
MapWorldsEstuary:
Where land springs from water,
life will shortly follow.
MapWorldsExcavation:
Two unexplored frontiers remain:
The skies and the soil.
MapWorldsFactory:
Repetition. Convention. Duplication.
Creation distilled to perfection.
MapWorldsFields:
They pleaded for the gods to bless their land.
Now they lie under the soil.
MapWorldsFloodedMine:
In darkness, beast and man
alike clamour to survive.
MapWorldsForkingRiver:
Great stone towers tore at the natural order
and were promptly put in their place.
MapWorldsFrozenCabins:
The fleet lay stranded in the winter wastes,
those aboard to never again see the light of day.
MapWorldsGardens:
Vibrant colours dash across the grey,
consuming Man's work.
MapWorldsGeode:
Many hands may
move a mountain.
MapWorldsGhetto:
Amongst the rabble,
brutality is the law.
MapWorldsGorge:
We must all walk the narrow, winding path.
The end is always the same.
MapWorldsGrotto:
Trapped in absolute darkness.
Despair. Panic. Terror.
MapWorldsHauntedMansion:
Forlorn and sorrowful, this once opulent
ruin conceals the sins of a fallen line.
MapWorldsHydra:
One of my captors wore many faces,
yet kept her true face hidden.
Now she cannot escape her true face.
MapWorldsIceberg:
Icy fangs seek tender hulls
to sink themselves into.
MapWorldsInfestedValley:
Should we feel disgusted at how the weak predate
the strong, or should we feel... admiration?
MapWorldsIvoryTemple:
Man and nature intertwined,
but only for the chosen few.
MapWorldsJungleValley: Verdant canopies shroud the world in darkness.
MapWorldsLaboratory:
My last waking moments looked very
much like this place... I miss it. I miss her.
MapWorldsLair:
In darkness, the alpha rises. The companionship
of beasts is fragile indeed.
MapWorldsLavaChamber:
Fiend and fortune-hunter alike turned to ash.
A sorry alliance of unending agony.
MapWorldsLavaLake:
At the heart of a peaceful, secluded valley,
an island of burning, consuming fury.
MapWorldsLeyline:
Amidst the barren wastes,
a slender strand of life blooms.
MapWorldsLighthouse:
Fire ignites the sky.
A signal to keep away.
An invitation to invade.
MapWorldsLookout:
A glorious vista once exclusive
to emperors. Not anymore.
MapWorldsMalformation:
Boils swell from the earth.
Foul malignant flesh
without purpose.
MapWorldsMarshes:
Embraced by mud. Grasped by roots.
The careless are silently swallowed.
MapWorldsMausoleum:
A vault for the dead, as if
they were valuable. Pathetic.
MapWorldsMaze:
They live trapped forever in darkness
and confusion. We are no different.
MapWorldsMazeUnique: We are ever the makers of our own undoing.
MapWorldsMesa:
Barren and sun-bleached.
Emptiness as far as
the eye can reach.
MapWorldsMineralPools:
God's jar of raw materials.
Life lying dormant,
waiting to sprout.
MapWorldsMinotaur:
One of my captors felt no emotion.
He did not hesitate to inflict pain.
Now all he feels is intense, unstoppable agony.
MapWorldsMoonTemple:
Night's promises are dark, for
even the stars must be harvested.
MapWorldsMoonTempleUnique:
In the shadow of war,
all are eclipsed.
MapWorldsMudGeyser:
Filth springs forth like blood
from a severed jugular.
MapWorldsMuseum:
Ancient artifacts and beautiful baubles.
All paid for in blood.
MapWorldsMuseumUnique:
Please take out your blades,
your whips, and your spikes.
Class is now in session.
MapWorldsNecropolis:
Even in death, we long to
be close to one another.
MapWorldsNecropolisUnique:
So the raiders danced,
leading their foe ever west,
towards certain death.
MapWorldsOrchard: The fruit that grows from bloody ground tastes sweetest.
MapWorldsOvergrownRuin:
Only fear remains unforgotten, where once
magnificent rites drew important crowds.
MapWorldsOvergrownShrine:
A once great monument,
now a forgotten memorial.
MapWorldsOvergrownShrineUnique:
Curious, she shook it then,
And tiny screams emerged.
Curiouser, she shook again,
And an eerie silence purred.
MapWorldsPalace:
Death forces even the most
determined of despots to
pass the crown.
MapWorldsPark: A brief respite in a sea of obligation and uncertainty.
MapWorldsPen:
Slaves held like cattle. A blood-soaked
revolution, just waiting to happen.
MapWorldsPeninsula:
The farmer no longer plows
or sows. Only the flattened
soil remains.
MapWorldsPhantasmagoria:
Every movement is watched,
recorded, remembered.
MapWorldsPhoenix:
One of my captors refused redemption.
He did not see value in a new life.
Now new life surrounds him.
MapWorldsPier:
Man's reach extends into
the ocean, clawing at
its infinite depths.
MapWorldsPit: Blood turns the soil to mud.
MapWorldsPlateau:
Steep cliffs divide where the trees
may grow, and where they may not.
MapWorldsPlaza: Drought took the plants, famine took the people.
MapWorldsPort:
The wealthy foolishly battle
the ocean for domain.
MapWorldsPrecinct:
Crushed together and fenced in,
to live out their lives like cattle.
MapWorldsPrimordialPool:
A dough of bad blood.
A yeast of ill will.
MapWorldsPromenade:
Even the greatest achievements
will eventually be abandoned.
MapWorldsPromenadeUnique:
The grandest and greatest
ever to fight,
Divine the champions stand tall.
But match their power,
best their might,
And even the immortal may fall.
MapWorldsRacecourse_: Rats chase their tails for the amusement of fools.
MapWorldsRamparts:
A wall is the surest sign for raiders
that there is something of value to take.
MapWorldsReef:
Each plank of rotting wood,
each dead sailor,
feeds the island and makes it grow.
MapWorldsRelicChambers:
Relics of a forbidden past.
Hidden away. Forgotten.
MapWorldsScriptorium:
Knowledge balanced atop a vast pit. Hold on,
or perish in the darkness of ignorance.
MapWorldsSepulchre:
Lives come and go.
Only bones and dust remain.
MapWorldsShapersRealm: The nexus of nothingness and equilibrium of eternity.
MapWorldsShipyard:
The stone and lumber sleeps.
The captains are long dead.
Only the sea knows their end.
MapWorldsShore: Each life, each act, as fleeting as footprints in the sand.
MapWorldsShoreUnique:
The Treasures of the Tides
wait in agony
at the End of the World.
MapWorldsShrine: Black tiles don't stain so easily.
MapWorldsSiege: No rest, no peace, no negotiation. Only War.
MapWorldsSilo:
Grim blessings whispered in the deepest,
most secret of places.
MapWorldsSpiderForest:
Each branch, each leaf,
an extension of a web
that spans sanity.
MapWorldsSpiderLair:
Panic only hastens the venom's
passage to the heart.
MapWorldsSprings:
The water brings life,
the poison takes it away.
MapWorldsStagnation_:
Aided by unrelenting rain,
rot devours new life at the first fumble.
MapWorldsStrand:
Nothing good washes up
on this dark shore.
MapWorldsStrandUnique:
We all began life in darkness,
we shall all end it there.
MapWorldsSulphurVents:
The creatures that prowl the wildest extremes,
nature anoints with cruel efficacy to defend her.
MapWorldsSummit:
We are swept ever upwards by our ambition,
with no thought of what awaits us at the peak.
MapWorldsSunkenCity:
From the walls, water, and ferns...
Death comes crawling on ancient steps.
MapWorldsTemple:
Immaculate white stone rises
from the abyss. Perfection.
MapWorldsTempleUnique:
Laughs of all the twisted
Echo through these
halls of gold.
In this cold forgotten void
They wander, forever uncontrolled.
MapWorldsTerrace:
A garden on a stone pedestal.
An incredible, and foolish, feat.
MapWorldsThaumaturgistsLair:
Ever does man look to emulate his creator,
only to match his indifference.
MapWorldsThicket:
Little light enters.
No life escapes.
MapWorldsTortureChamber:
Who is the true criminal, the one behind
bars, or the one who tortures him?
MapWorldsTortureChamberUnique:
"Here the soil is more deadly
than any swing of the axe."
- Oba of the Karui,
Conqueror of Corruption.
MapWorldsTower: We ascend to great heights to commit low acts.
MapWorldsToxicSewer:
Affluence and effluence, separated
by a few feet of soil.
MapWorldsTribunal: So much power in the hands of so few.
MapWorldsTropicalIsland:
The temptations of paradise
draw forth the good
and the bad alike.
MapWorldsUndergroundRiver:
Life, like still water, becomes trapped.
Stagnant. Foul.
MapWorldsUndergroundRiverUnique:
Howls and laughter
They hide in the day
They smell you, they watch you
They track their new prey
MapWorldsUndergroundSea:
Silent stillness. The waters are
as cold as they are black.
MapWorldsVaalPyramid:
A good slave is driven by
only two thoughts:
service and sacrifice.
MapWorldsVaalPyramidUnique:
"Should I depart this mortal coil,
so shall all of my treasures."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
MapWorldsVaalTemple:
Voices. Visions. Violence.
They will haunt these grounds for all of eternity.
MapWorldsVault:
Wealth beyond imagining,
locked beyond reach.
MapWorldsVilla:
Wealth is powerless to stop
the corroding force of time.
MapWorldsVolcano: Tremble in the might of the flames.
MapWorldsWasteland:
A white bone stripped of its fertile flesh.
Life spirals towards its end.
MapWorldsWaterways:
A river in the sky, far from that
which so desperately needs it.
MapWorldsWharf:
Reach out into the abyss,
and the abyss reaches back.
MavenKey:
It would be foolish to obey the Maven's demands.
It would also be foolish not to.
MavenKeyFragment:
Precious and perilous,
Tantalising and terrible.
MavenTrial:
For those who must not endure it,
there may be found a perverse joy 
in watching the struggle for survival.
MawrBlaidd: Rigwald believed he'd seized great power, but it was the great power that had seized Rigwald
MercilessArmament:
"Through thick and thin,
blood and bone,
a peaceful life
is one I can't condone."
- Tukohama, Father Of War
MightIsRight: The mind had much to endure before the advent of thaumaturgy.
Mitts: Those whose hands are their livelihood know the importance of keeping them safe and warm.
NoTraces: <size:31>{There is no mistake so great that it cannot be undone.}
OfferingDedication:
Before the Goddess, nothing remains hidden.
Adversity reveals old flaws and new strengths.
OfferingGift:
The Goddess abides a kingdom beyond compare,
should you meet her challenge.
OfferingToTheGoddess:
It is time for the Goddess to give her final verdict.
Your fate rests in her even hands.
OfferingTribute:
You may appeal to the Goddess for another verdict,
but justice favours only the truly worthy.
OrbOfVeiledChaosFlavour:
"The Order tried for centuries to shield the world from chaos.
But chaos is natural. It is a tool, like any other, with which to
shape our destinies." - The Lifegiver's Manifesto
Perfection: There are countless worlds, but only those with limitless potential will be able to achieve perfection.
PrideBeforeTheFall:
<size:27>{As Kaom slew the last of his kin,
something deep inside him broke.
And through the cracks, corruption,
pure and black, spread forth.}
PrimordialWatchstone1:
The Maven knew nothing of mercy
until she herself needed it.
PrimordialWatchstone2:
The Elder fed on all that gave life meaning
until it encountered an unbreakable bond.
PrimordialWatchstone3:
The Eater of Worlds consumed for countless
eons to satiate the desperation of masters
that could never be satisfied.
PrimordialWatchstone4:
The Searing Exarch spread the Word of
Enlightenment for countless eons without
ever understanding its master's message.
ProphecyFragment1:
Mouth of the Masses, whose greatness spreads by our breath and touch,
who feeds the starving with the starved, the strong with the weak.
ProphecyFragment2:
Lord of the Wild, of the feral and frenzied,
of the uncivilized, the untamed, the untouched.
ProphecyFragment3:
The Infinite Mind, unbound by the tethers of sanity,
whose thirst for knowledge is all-consuming,
whose every word stands our hair on end.
ProphecyFragment4_:
She of Many Bodies, whose very flesh unites all,
whose dark whispers draw forth our souls, unfettered.
Prosperity: Accumulating wealth has its own costs.
QuestA9Ingredient1: "Blow it all down! The emperor must have his gems, no matter the cost!"
QuestA9Ingredient2:
Nobility once thought to capture the Basilisks and keep them as exotic pets.
This only served to fatten the vileness of their hearts, and with a hateful
acid that festered inside, the creatures became soured to their very bones.
QuestAllflame:
Distilled from naked ambition and unfettered obsession,
the Allflame emanates a silvern warmth like no other, 
and engulfs those moths fool enough to embrace it.
QuestAnkhOfEternity: "The amulet, it... whispers to me. Horrible things..."
QuestAvariusStaff_:
"Worry not for the heathens. They are devoid of soul.
Made vessels of wrath, they are damned by holy design."
- High Templar Avarius
QuestBestelManuscript:
"A stranger's kiss on a moonlit night.
Dost thou believe in love at first sight?"
QuestBlackFlag:
"May the lubbers feel fear in their
nethers, and may our blades follow."
 - Rot-tooth's Rallying Cry
QuestBlackVenom:
"The spider is not defined by how
it lives, but by how it kills."
 - Inquisitor Maligaro
QuestBottledStorm:
"One should not entice the storm; one cannot invite the storm, or give warrant
to its tyrant-soul. We survive only by appeasing the storm, with gifts and
offerings of adoration. We hope that, in its mercy, it shall pass us by."
- Tempestology of the Maraketh, Repudion IV
QuestBust1:
The Emperor honours Hector Titucius as Supreme Servant.
"Strength in purpose is strength in deed."
QuestBust2:
The Emperor honours Gaius Sentari as Supreme Servant.
"A man's thoughts are his shackles. A man's thoughts are his wings."
QuestBust3:
The Emperor honours Marceus Lioneye as Supreme Servant.
"The road to Glory is paved with Sacrifice."
QuestCalendar:
The King looked upon images swirling atop the ancient stone dial.
"You look peaceful" he told his bride-to-be, "So peaceful, asleep in our wedding bed."
But in phantasm, she did not slumber, and what he saw was not a place for dreams,
rather, a wooden box... about to be closed and lowered into earthy depths.
 - Maraketh Legend
QuestCombinedAmulet:
Though its power has been shared, there
is still more the Apex might unlock.
QuestDaressoGem:
"It is a cruel joke that 
Man was born with more 
Intent than Life."
- Malachai
QuestDecanter:
"Man is blinded by the mud of his corporeal self. Only
through the transformation of the material into the
spiritual can we hope to taste the full body of life."
- Malachai the Soulless
QuestDexAmulet:
While this artefact resonates with power,
it is simply a piece in a larger puzzle.
QuestDominusKey: Some sins were never meant to be remembered...
QuestFirefly1: In all things living, the light burns bright.
QuestFirefly2: A passionate fire that consumes the heart.
QuestFirefly3: The Spirit, it radiates not from above.
QuestFirefly4: It is the warmth that draws you ever inward.
QuestFirefly5: Where rest the truest colours of life.
QuestFirefly6: Gold of the organ. Green of the throat. Red of the vein.
QuestFirefly7: The myriad wet rainbow of the Spirit's domain.
QuestGlyph1:
Its corrugated surface brings a strange tingle
to the fingertips. This is no mere decoration.
QuestGlyph2:
When put to the ear it whispers not of
the sea, but long dead incantations.
QuestGlyph3:
Its pleasing sheen remains even in shadow,
as if it were somehow lit from within.
QuestGoldenHand:
An open palm raised in peace,
cut down by the slaves of war.
QuestGreustNecklace:
"A boy becomes a man when he has faced the animal
in his heart and wet the forest floor with its blood."
 - Azmeri Proverb
QuestHinekorasHair:
"What we steal in life we repay in death."
 - Karui Proverb
QuestInfernalTalc:
"A Virtue Gem is a raging thunderstorm imprisoned within a single raindrop.
Infernal Talc simply lets the storm out." - Malachai the Soulless
QuestIntAmulet:
Segregated by treachery, this artefact
longs to be reunited with her sisters.
QuestKaomGem:
"Fear becomes Hatred. 
Hatred becomes Fury. 
Thus is Man transformed 
from Martyr to Maker." 
- Malachai
QuestKaruiEye:
"Weakness must be purged lest it
poison the blood of all Karui."
 - Prayer to Tukohama
QuestKisharaStar: To the wily Kishara's eye, a star brighter than the sun.
QuestKitavaKey:
Wrought from blood and gold, Innocence fashioned a weapon of tempered purity,
capable of banishing darkness, and bringing order to the chaos in men's hearts.
QuestMalachaisEntrails:
My organs tether me to mortality
like a chain. This chain holds me
from my true potential.
QuestMalachaisHeart:
My heart forces blood through my veins.
But one who may bleed may die, and
death is no fitting end to genius.
QuestMalachaisLungs:
My lungs breathe the same air as
the foolish and the weak. May I be
yet another step removed from them.
QuestMaligaroMap:
"Certain maps can only be rendered in the most vivid of viscera."
 - Inquisitor Maligaro
QuestMedicineChest:
Doctor "Shaky Hands" Opden travelled with only the
finest medicines and antidotes... and a curiously
generous supply of opiates.
QuestMiasmeter:
"We shall peer at these cosmic wonderments as they
wake and writhe within that deep and nameless dark."
 - Vilenta, 'Miasmeter: A Thesis'
QuestMoonOrb:
"Moonlight is a wise mother. The moon which bathes us in soft,
cooling light, does so with the intent of illuminating our paths.
Moonlight is wisdom. Moonlight is life."
 - The Lunar Verses
QuestObsidianKey:
"The cool blanket of shadows preserves our treasures."
 - Inquisitor Maligaro
QuestPage1:
"The Vaal were even more steeped in gem culture than 
our Emperor and his 'Gemlings'. It's an obsession 
as old as civilisation itself."
- Icius Perandus
QuestPage2:
"A communion... but with what? By all accounts, 
it wasn't God that the Vaal were trying to reach."
- Icius Perandus
QuestPage3:
"A waking Nightmare. 
Madness of the mind? 
Or madness of the flesh?"
- Icius Perandus
QuestPage4:
"Siosa, your Slavery will cause them to overlook you. 
Your Karui Way will guide you. 
Your Humanity will shame us all."
- Icius Perandus
QuestPlum: As succulent as blood, as sweet as power.
QuestPoisonGem:
The withering glare of corruption, made
corporeal and pellucid in crystal.
QuestPoisonSpear:
Maligaro loved his tools, and took great
pains to keep them excruciatingly sharp.
QuestPotion:
Famous for her many lovers, those that did not
come willing to Atziri, came by liquid persuasion.
QuestRedBanner: When the sun sets, the plains should be red.
QuestRibbonSpool:
Machinery makes the minions.
Minions make the master.
QuestSekhemaFeather:
"And how shall we know a sekhema worthy of rule? 
By the anointing of the Great Roc, under whose wings we grow and soar."
 - Maraketh Coronation Ritual
QuestSewerKeys:
To enter a city's bowels is to be
privy to its best-kept secrets.
QuestSilverLocket:
From Weylam to Meredith:
I shall love thee as I love the sea.
QuestSpikeKey: A sigil of thaumaturgy graven in granite.
QuestStormSword:
Garukhan sought madness and knowledge amongst the billowing clouds of a 
blackened sky. A vulture of pride, she would not be refused, and so the
stratosphere divulged unto her eldritch secrets of its tumultuous past.
QuestStrAmulet:
A relic of a sundered relationship,
it awaits reconciliation with its kin.
QuestSunOrb:
"The sun is a devoted mother. She casts her golden blessings on
the crops of the pious and makes barren the fields of heresy.
Sunlight is belief. Sunlight is life."
 - The Solar Verses
QuestTeardrop:
"T'gnagn iia y r'ngusla ph'tu Tsoatha nga mekghul'an."
 - Indecipherable verse
QuestTemplarCourtKey:
Eyes blazing with holy flame, the Pilgrim saw
a great palace descend from the burgeoning sky,
its gates barred against the unfaithful.
QuestThaumeticSulphite:
Essence of pure thaumaturgy.
Apply with trepidation.
QuestTolmanBracelet:
A craftswoman's ode to
fresh hope, a new love.
QuestTowerKey:
God will only offer the door.
Man must choose whether to open it.
QuestTukohamasTooth:
"The belly cannot hunger for what the eyes cannot see."
 - Karui Proverb
QuestValakosJaw:
"One day you eat the fish. One day you feed the fish."
 - Karui Proverb
QuestWingsOfVastiri:
And mounting her mighty Roc, Garukhan, holy queen of the sky,
descended upon her enemies and their armies of darkness.
RainOfChaos:
<size:27>{Fire filled the sky that night 
Chaos reigned 
Where the shards fell 
All was destroyed 
-Jozen Kasigi, retelling an urban legend of the Cataclysm}
Rats: Whoever said 'more is always better' has obviously never met a rat.
Rebirth:
He shattered Her smile
Scattered the fragments like ash
All she did was laugh
Ring11: God blesses those who bless themselves.
Ring12: To truly appreciate life you must be there when it ends
Ring13:
"Shavronne held Sanity in her right
hand and Revelation in her left.
Brutus chose the left hand."
- Kadavrus, Surgeon to the Umbra
ScarabAbyss1:
As the hordes of bone and blood and foul magic surge across the Vastiri Plains,
the scant survivors of our akhara agree to your alliance, ash-scarred Ahkeli.
Disorder means death. Order may mean life.
ScarabAbyss2:
Your golems and your leadership have slowed the tide of death, Clayshaper.
The relics of power you bid us find have kept the Vastiri Plains from the brink
of oblivion. The defences of the Maraketh will hold.
ScarabAbyss3:
The Winter of the World has ended at the hands of the Three Sisters. We lay this scarab
upon your ancient grave in thanks for your efforts, Honoured Founder. As you hoped,
the fate of your people will never befall another.
ScarabAbyss4:
The Abyssals creep forth by night and by storm. Their eons underground were not
a respite, but an amassing, and now they number beyond comprehension.
ScarabBeasts1:
Feuding Ezomytes slaughtered your kin, young Agnar, but we pulled you
from the flames. The Order of the Djinn is your clan now.
ScarabBeasts2:
None among us understand the beasts of this world better than you,
honoured Agnar. You will root out the mysteries of wild-artefacts.
ScarabBeasts3:
The Order was your clan in life, Agnar, Beastmaster, but the First Ones call
back their favoured son. The gift of their Visions will pass to another.
ScarabBeasts4:
Without an experienced Beastmaster to find them new realms,
the First Ones' ravaging hunt brings them ever closer to Wraeclast.
ScarabBeasts4a:
Without an experienced Beastmaster to find them new realms,
the First Ones' ravaging hunt brings them ever closer to Wraeclast.
ScarabBeasts4b:
Without an experienced Beastmaster to find them new realms,
the First Ones' ravaging hunt brings them ever closer to Wraeclast.
ScarabBeasts4c:
Without an experienced Beastmaster to find them new realms,
the First Ones' ravaging hunt brings them ever closer to Wraeclast.
ScarabBeasts4d:
Without an experienced Beastmaster to find them new realms,
the First Ones' ravaging hunt brings them ever closer to Wraeclast.
ScarabBlight1:
We pulled you from the raging ocean, young Dhunan,
but we cannot return you to your home. The Order of the Djinn
offers you a place on Wraeclast.
ScarabBlight2:
For using the techniques of your homeland to contain
the fungal plague, honoured Dhunan, you shall lead the war
to eliminate it and end the century-cycle of infestation.
ScarabBlight3:
Be at rest, Blightmaster Dhunan, on the distant shores of
your home. A dangerous expedition, but one worthy for
he who gave his life to cleanse Wraeclast.
ScarabBlight4:
The fungal plague returns, and its roots have adapted.
The undiscovered Blightheart that Dhunan theorised
must still exist somewhere, yet none remain
with the skill to see to its destruction.
ScarabBreach1:
The Ember-dwellers sought to throw you to their volcanic god, young Omid,
but we caught you instead. The Order of the Djinn is your tribe now.
ScarabBreach2:
We task you, honoured Omid, with the investigation of this mysterious
'Xoph' and artefacts related to rifts in the boundaries of our world.
ScarabBreach3:
Omid, Master Researcher, has left a final commandment upon his death:
the world must never know.
ScarabBreach4:
The Master Researcher's final commandment has failed.
The High Templar has seen the truth of our situation,
and the world will be undone by his fear.
ScarabDivinationCards1:
You were a casualty of callous Karui warfare, ageless Narumoa, but the Order
mended your wounds. You are bound to us now by your own code.
ScarabDivinationCards2:
Though your peers fear you, Narumoa, the elders have decided that your
second sight is ideal for handling all artefacts that seek to subvert Fate.
ScarabDivinationCards3:
Your centuries of service have been invaluable to us, Narumoa. Go now,
return to Hinekora, and join your ancient kin in the halls of the dead.
ScarabDivinationCards4:
Hinekora has sent the world another herald, but this hatungo walks another path.
We are left blinded, and subject to the vagaries of Fate.
ScarabElderRares1_:
Your visions led the Azmeri down into a world left abandoned by the Vaal.
They cast you out, young Egrin, but the Order of the Djinn accepts you.
ScarabElderRares2_:
Speaker of unclean truths, Egrin of the Dark Between Stars.
We curse you whose soul echoes the madness of the void!
ScarabElderRares3:
Egrin of the Dark Between Stars, Forger of the Sealing Blade,
let your name be redeemed by your unexpected sacrifice.
ScarabElderRares4:
We are all equally fools for our childish notions.
That dread force Decay cannot be defeated by self-sacrifice.
ScarabHarbinger1:
Your ancestry has been much maligned by history, young Sarina Titucius,
but to the Order of the Djinn, you are born anew.
ScarabHarbinger2:
For deciphering the language of the inscrutable ones, honoured Sarina,
we charge you with investigating their intent in our land.
ScarabHarbinger3:
For your valour beyond the Gate, Sarina Titucius, we honour you with the first
Gilded Scarab awarded while its recipient still lives. Remain vigilant.
ScarabHarbinger4:
The thousand year truce has faltered, for the inscrutable ones have imprisoned their own God.
Should they invade again, there will be no warning.
ScarabLegion1:
Your faith and our Order are not in opposition, young Eutychus. 
Let this be the start of a new era of cooperation.
ScarabLegion2:
As our hand in the Chamber, we grant you, Deacon Eutychus,
access to a domain we lack the resources to explore.
ScarabLegion3:
Given the fate of Deacon Eutychus and the men under Cardinal Sanctus Vox,
let none dare the Domain, lest they too feed that vile hunger eternal.
ScarabLegion4:
As the passage between Wraeclast and the land beyond time's reach is torn open,
we stand on the precipice of eternal war.
And no one remains to hold us back.
ScarabMaps1:
Consider yourself an orphaned Eternal no longer, young Betucia.
The Order of the Djinn is your family now.
ScarabMaps2:
For your loyalty and valour, honoured Betucia, we are proud to put
the requisition of dream-artefacts in your capable hands.
ScarabMaps3:
Betucia, Bearer of the Sealing Blade, the Order of the Djinn survives
because of your sacrifice, but will be forever wounded by your loss.
ScarabMaps4:
The Sealing Blade has been removed, and the agent of Decay
shall feed upon this world until nothing remains but dust.
ScarabMetamorph1:
Rejected even by the Faridun outcasts, young Saresh, you were cursed to walk the
white sands until we found you. The Order shall command your penance now.
ScarabMetamorph2:
As you explore the vast well of human darkness, Saresh, our Surgeon of the Dead,
remember that the price can sometimes exceed the value of knowledge.
ScarabMetamorph3:
There was a man of bone, rotting flesh, and weeping black, but his name, his
ill-gotten knowledge, and his role in the Order shall be stricken from memory.
ScarabMetamorph4:
Though the Necromancer of Weeping Black fell in the desert by the hand of Garukhan,
his mindless legions remain scattered throughout Wraeclast, with no master to curb their hunger.
ScarabPerandus1:
Your people no longer walk this continent, young Revna,
but the Order of the Djinn will give you a new home.
ScarabPerandus2:
As you delve into the mysteries of this world, apprentice Revna,
remember to learn from the past, not be consumed by it.
ScarabPerandus3:
We lay you to rest in the forest deep, Runesmith Revna, so that you may be
forever hidden from the stars which so terrified you in your final days.
May the secret you took to your grave be lifted from your burdens.
ScarabPerandus4:
Darkness surges in the shadows of the past. Ancient evils stir. The stars
watch, forever aloof, forever menacing. None remain who know the
secret, so we are defenseless in the face of the unknown.
ScarabShaperRares1:
The Peak-dwellers saw you as impure, young Qianga, but the Order of
the Djinn sees you as all the stronger for your uniqueness.
ScarabShaperRares2:
Bold dreamer, Qianga of the Stars, she of the Celestial Cold! These titles
we bestow upon the one among us whose soul speaks to the ineffable.
ScarabShaperRares3:
Qianga of the Stars, Deliverer of the Sealing Blade to the Watchers, go now, and
let your half-dreamt life be troubled by nightmares of achromic hunger no more.
ScarabShaperRares4:
The Watchers have gone silent, yet they scream still.
Something lurks among the stars of our dreams, knocking at the door,
whispering with the voices of long lost friends...
ScarabStrongbox1:
Your outlaw camp abandoned you when their surprise attack failed, young Rindwik.
Now that you know we exist, we cannot let you go. You have two choices.
ScarabStrongbox2:
Your people were renegades, Rindwik, but you have proven your loyalty.
You will lead the martial defence of our expeditions.
ScarabStrongbox3:
Master Warrior Rindwik fell to one opponent alone: old age.
Only the greatest soldiers can say as much.
ScarabStrongbox4:
In the absence of a strong martial presence, the renegades rise once more.
Their poisons threaten to cloud the land.
ScarabSulphite1:
As the first Brinerot to join the Order, you have much to prove,
young Raethan. We are confident you will succeed.
ScarabSulphite2:
For harnessing and controlling the power of lightning, you, Raethan,
are now charged with researching this new energy.
ScarabSulphite3:
Let him not be called Raethan the Betrayer. His discovery was too important
to keep locked away. Now, for good or ill, it is in civilisation's hands.
ScarabSulphite4:
Madness marches in machine form.
Harnessed lightning, grim faces, and cold ambition abounds.
Civilisation will be its own undoing.
ScarabTorment1:
Young Tsarsk, you were a broken and forgotten child lying glassy-eyed
in a flesh-pit in Trarthus, but the Order found and cleansed you.
ScarabTorment2:
Your tortured soul long kept you isolated from your peers, Tsarsk, but has attracted
new kindred in kind. You are tasked with appeasing these anguished spirits.
ScarabTorment3:
Though you were swallowed by your own darkness, you saved countless others
from eternal misery, young Tsarsk. You were not nothing, as you feared.
ScarabTorment4:
Without a speaker of the dead, the countless anguished spirits only grow in number.
They have no voice, and no hope. The sun darkens with each passing year.
ScarabUniques1:
The Maraketh left you to die alone in the desert, young Sumei, but we
saw the potential in you. The Order of the Djinn is your akhara now.
ScarabUniques2:
As the best of our lorekeepers, honoured Sumei, it is now your task
to investigate the mysterious duplication of artefacts of power.
ScarabUniques3:
Go to your rest now, Sumei, Master Lorekeeper. The Order shall keep
contained the terrible secret that burdened your final years.
ScarabUniques4:
The books were burned, and the scribes set themselves aflame.
What secret so terrible could they have discovered?
Though centuries have passed, we must investigate this for ourselves.
ScholarOfTheSeas: I've never come upon a ship I could not command. I have however met sailors that were not willing to be led.
SentinelController:
For aeons, ancient constructs have lain dormant,
but now their designs are under your control.
ShaperFragment1:
Enter the crucible. The nexus of
nothingness and equilibrium of eternity.
ShaperFragment2:
Enter the crucible. The nexus of
nothingness and equilibrium of eternity.
ShaperFragment3:
Enter the crucible. The nexus of
nothingness and equilibrium of eternity.
ShaperFragment4:
Enter the crucible. The nexus of
nothingness and equilibrium of eternity.
ShaperKey:
I spent my life shining a light on truth...
but some things should remain in darkness,
locked away for all eternity.
ShaperMemoryFragment10_1:
"...It wasn't long before we were met by the Shade itself.
The very essence of the Elder, demanding of me in visions to
tell it why I had returned. But before I could answer,
Venarius stepped forward and greeted the phantom..."
ShaperMemoryFragment10_2:
"...Before we knew it, we stood at the base of that blasphemous effigy.
"Pull the sword from my chest." The Elder imposed, and Venarius didn't hesitate.
The earth shook in the face of the Elder's reunion with its body. The true scope of the
Elder befell the High Templar and his men, and as it began to feed, I began to run..."
ShaperMemoryFragment10_3:
"...I fear this to be the end. Not just the end for me, but the end of all things. 
The Elder has been freed. Soon it will feast on me... on the rest of the world.
It was too late for me. The Elder had to be stopped. I knew of the shaping powers.
Only I could have a hope at defeating the Elder..."
ShaperMemoryFragment1_1:
"...A golden machine was found broken in the ruins of Wraeclast. 
Believing it to contain some dark infernal secret, 
High Templar Venarius asked that I restore it 
and weaponize whatever powers it might contain..."
ShaperMemoryFragment2_1:
"...Though the device seemed to be mostly functioning, 
something important appeared to be missing...
...I worked tirelessly in search of answers, until finally, 
at the base of that cruel device, I fell into a deep, deep sleep..."
ShaperMemoryFragment3_1:
"...I awoke in the most beautiful of places, and as I wandered this strange new land, 
I felt a growing sense of realization that I was not alone. 
A Shade, a whisper of embodied smoke, spoke to me through thoughts and pictures.
I found myself enthusiastically volunteering information in detail of Oriath..."
ShaperMemoryFragment4_1:
"...The Shade knew of the device - a doorway between my world
and the dreamlands. It offered to help me rebuild the missing part, 
to create a conduit between this beautiful land and Oriath. 
All that the Shade asked of me was to return the favour..."
ShaperMemoryFragment5_1:
"...Every night, I found myself asleep at the foot of the strange device, 
awoken to the reality of another world within my own.
The Shade taught me how to shape and build things from my imagination,
how to transport such phantasmagorical treasures back into the world of man..."
ShaperMemoryFragment6_1:
"...The missing part of the great device had finally been formed.
The Shade requested its one favour. I was shown images of the past,
the Shade as King of the dreamlands, the hateful Watchers of Decay...
It led me deep into a cave, to a statue pierced by a sword..."
ShaperMemoryFragment7_1:
"Pull the blade from my chest. Free me!" the Shade imposed.
But doubt entered my mind, and the Shade flew into a fury!
I felt my mind torn asunder as images of murder and mutilation were forced upon me. 
I fled in a panic, cursing myself for ever trusting such a strange creature so blindly..."
ShaperMemoryFragment8_1:
"...Months have now passed since the Shade revealed its true nature.
Each morning, I lock myself inside my study, searching for some knowledge 
that might save us. I have found at last, some information on the Watchers of Decay. 
The truth is so unutterable that I hesitate, even now, to write it down..."
ShaperMemoryFragment8_2:
"...They called it the Elder. A creature of malignant madness... it cannot be killed.
The Watchers built the device to lock tight its kingdom, bringing with them the
blade - 'Starforge'. A weapon to give the Elder eternal rest. But the Shade...
I must find a way to put a stop to it before it finds a path to freedom..."
ShaperMemoryFragment9_1:
"...I've spent every waking hour since, trying to find a way to end this unholy Elder.
Within my secret study, I've begun work on a device of my own, tinkering and shaping.
When I'm finished, this Elder will never bother our world again.
The creature cannot be killed, but maybe... it can be exiled..."
ShaperMemoryFragment9_2:
"...Lack of progress on the device has given the High Templar cause for suspicion.
Clapped in irons, I was lead off to the Theopolis prisons for my insubordination.
I must find my way from these chains at all costs. The Elder is coming for us.
Only I can save us from this blasphemy that will soon befall Oriath..."
ShaperMemoryFragment9_3:
"...Venarius, that bastard... he marched me through the streets.
His men beat me within an inch of death... I... I told him everything. 
He demanded that I take all of us into the dreamlands, to meet with the Elder.
Using the device, we stepped through, setting foot in the Atlas of Worlds..."
ShardOfFate:
Their whims left unknown,
Their life left for others.
SirusFragment1:
He sought to be the best,
but lost his family.
SirusFragment2:
He sought God,
but lost himself.
SirusFragment3:
He sought a kingdom,
but lost his people.
SirusFragment4:
She sought to bring salvation,
but lost her compassion.
StruckByLightning:
'Lightning never strikes the same place twice'
is really just wishful thinking.
Talisman1_1:
The First Ones stalk with us
upon this lifelong hunt,
and cast their contempt
upon those that would make us their prey.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_10:
The First Ones hold us
between two sharpened blades.
That should we stray too far from the path,
we find ourselves severed.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_11:
The world of the First Ones is harsh;
We struggle on our bellies to survive.
But that which imprisons us also changes us
And soon we will emerge anew.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_12:
For too long we have crawled in darkness,
scavenging through rotten scraps.
The First Ones teach us to scavenge until we can hunt,
and then never crawl again.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_2:
The civilised man must wrestle
with the demands of heart and mind.
The First Ones share no such struggle.
For their Spirit is swift and deadly certain.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_3:
The fire of the hearth is a docile dog,
leashed and tamed.
The fire of the First Ones is a ravening wolf,
wild and free.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_4:
The First Ones thundered over Ezomyr
upon hooves of grey and black.
The people felt their stamping rage
and cowered as the fury rained down.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_5:
We have basked in the cloying warmth of servitude.
Now the First Ones harden us
against the numbing chill of despair
so that freedom will not slip through our trembling fingers.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_6:
I stood among the stones
And called out to the First Ones;
That with tooth and mighty claw,
They should tear our enemies asunder.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_7:
The Empire poisons our blood with sweet wine.
Poisons our flesh with silk.
Poisons our minds with civil lies.
Poisons our children with servitude.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_8:
'Sleep when you are weary,' our mothers told us.
'Sleep when you are dead,' our fathers told us.
To the First Ones, the slumbering and the corpse
are one and the same.
- The Wolven King
Talisman1_9:
To catch a big fish you need tempting bait. 
And there is no fish bigger than the Empire,
and no bait as tempting as Ezomyr.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_1:
The Hunter faced the First One
and notched his final arrow.
The First One bared its fangs
and savoured its final breath.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_2:
With the will of the first ones in our sinews
we shall tear down the walls of Sarn.
Yet as is the way of the wildlands,
Only the strong may grow stronger.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_3:
It's said to be noble to stand one's ground.
To soak the earth in stalwart blood.
While the First Ones chose to laugh and run
and caper with untamed glee.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_4:
From flesh and ferocity,
the First Ones roamed
through the realm of Spirit,
and into the darkness beyond. 
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_5:
Fear the children of the First Ones.
Let fear shield your back.
And let the dullard speak of bravery
when the First Ones come for him.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_6:
The first ones live where they can, where they must.
They embrace the frost, the storm, the drought.
Waxing and waning, breaking and mending,
living with time and happenstance, as must we.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_7:
The First Ones are the forever ones.
There is no dust of the hourglass in their blood.
No fissures of weariness in their faces.
To drink of their blood is to drink of time itself.
- The Wolven King
Talisman2_8:
The Empire hides lies and falsehoods
Behind a mask of politeness and civility.
The First Ones teach us to look through the lies,
And that no beast can truly cover their tracks.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_1:
We Ezomytes are beasts of burden
bearing wealth of an empire on our backs,
growing lean and strong
while our masters grow fat and weak.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_2:
When we free ourselves from the shackles
of civilised existence
we learn to feed and run and breathe
as the First Ones have always done.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_3:
The first ones marked their hunting grounds
with blood and piss.
We have tried to paint our future in words.
Now we shall paint with inks of savagery.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_4:
We grew contemptuous of our past.
Dismissed the first ones as ignorant and wild.
We were fools and naive children
to turn our backs on our inheritance.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_5:
Death met with the First Ones
and demanded they hunt with mercy.
For while pain might delight the mind,
it does not fill the belly.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_6:
Look not upon me with fear, my men.
Though I seem strange, even monstrous,
were you to see with the eyes of your forebears,
your hearts would be filled with wonder.
- The Wolven King
Talisman3_7:
We breed thoughts of single mind,
fashion tools of single purpose.
While the First Ones bring to bear
anything that the wildlands provide.
- The Wolven King
Talisman4:
The wolf greeted the king,
In the light of the harvest moon.
