The wolf offered the strength of the wild,
And the king paid for it in blood.
TangleBossKeyFlavourText:
From the heart of the Tangle, the Eater of Worlds
reaches out for control of the Atlas.
TangleKeyFlavourText:
The Infinite Hunger awaits in a cosmic stomach where
whole civilisations are digested - but do not die.
TemporaryTutorialSupport: This gem is only temporary, and only for the tutorial.
TestUniqueRing1:
"When one stares into the depth of the flavour text
file, one will gain no knowledge, only an addiction
to speculation." - Maligaro, Grand Trolllord
TheAdmirer: Lucian lost himself in ancient scrolls and found in those scrolls a love whose power bridged a millennium.
TheAesthete:
"Some see our mortal flesh as a limitation. I see it as an opportunity for vast, miraculous improvements."
- Shavronne of Umbra
TheArenaChampion: The fight is the easy part. It's the years of training that'll kill you.
TheArmyOfBlood:
<size:28>{I gave my mind without a fight, 
The twelfth hour I lost control. 
The day is gone but there is light, 
eyes that glow like red-hot coal.}
TheArtist: "Paint, metal, flesh... A true artist does not limit himself." - Malachai the Soulless
TheAvenger:
Justice comes swift 
Equal to the crime 
Revenge is a gift 
Life for a life 
Eye for an eye
TheBattleBorn: "No man can best me, no demon can fell me. For I vanquish all with my axe!"
TheBeast: To know the monster, you must become the monster.
TheBetrayal: It's sad times we live in when a friendship has a price people are willing to pay.
TheBlazingFire: Lethal, untouchable, keen, aflame. Just what I was looking for.
TheBody: They say it is the head that leads, but all must flow through the body at some point.
TheBreach: Ever get the feeling you're being watched...?
TheBrittleEmperor:
<size:31>{"When Voll spared Malachai, accepting his aid in pursuit of Purity, the strongest faith was infected by Corruption and made brittle as glass."
- Victario, the People's Poet}
TheCacophony: Nothing can be heard above the din or seen amongst the turmoil. The senses are shattered. All is left to fate.
TheCalling: <size:32>{Blood flows not just through veins, but through worlds.}
TheCarrionCrow:
From death, life. 
From life, death. 
The wheel turns, 
and the corbies wheel overhead.
TheCartographer: <size:31>{It's always easier to find your way if you draw a map of the progress you've made.}
TheCataclysm: <size:27>{The mighty warriors traded in blows, the nimble archers in arrows, yet it was the brazen thaumaturgists who would bring catastrophe to all.}
TheCatalyst: Simple actions can lead the world to an early grave.
TheCelestialJusticar: Wrapped in the glory of the heavens, she comes to mete out justice for the fallen.
TheCelestialStone: Stare into its depths too long, and you may lose yourself entirely.
TheChainsThatBind: Scarier than any criminal is an innocent man in chains, for when he breaks free, his revenge will be justified.
TheComingStorm: No man may hope to turn back the storm. You can only hope you do not attract its ire.
TheConduit: The path to godhood is guided by the hand of sacrifice.
TheCursedKing:
The First Ones
may be blasphemy,
but they are
powerful blasphemy.
TheDapperProdigy: "Many believe murder is a grisly, grim, and grotesque crime. Then there are those who simply make art of it."
TheDarkMage:
With staff in hand
and wrath in heart,
your soul and corpse
shall surely part.
TheDarkestDream: A dream from which you cannot awake is nothing other than a nightmare.
TheDeceiver: Beware the combatant who shows no confidence, yet still enters the ring, for they are surely hiding something.
TheDemoness: Wherever she went, death was sure to follow.
TheDevastator: Only a fool tries to contain unlimited power.
TheDoctor: "They said I needed my head examined, but I'd rather just take yours." - Klopek the Cannibal
TheDoppelganger: Upon seeing her face, I am terrified—the moon shows me my own form!
TheDragon:
<size:28>{Scaly beast of the skies,
watching with his golden eyes.
Shadow that blocks out the sun,
it's too late for you to run.}
TheDragonsHeart: They say when a dragon dies, the flesh smoulders and burns until all that remains is the still, white-hot, heart.
TheDreamer:
<size:29>{A dark note drips 
from the dreamer's lips, 
A honeyed melody. 
We stand, we fall 
on his beck and call, 
for in his dream we're free.}
TheDreamland: All dreams vanish when the dreamers wake.
TheDrunkenAristocrat: The finer the brew, the harder it is to remember drinking it.
TheEncroachingDarkness: No matter where your dreams take you, Nightmare follows close behind.
TheEndlessDarkness: Gaze towards the stars, but beware what gazes back.
TheEndurance:
<size:28>{Crimson rubies, drops of vigour,
flowing through my veins,
flesh like coal, try to crush me,
diamond is what remains.}
TheEnlightended:
Weaving the six,
a serpent stands tall.
Wearing a crown,
the thousand petals call.
TheEthereal:
<size:30>{"Long ago, people looked to the stars, believing they influenced us. Soon, it will be us who influence the stars."
- Doryani, Queen's Thaumaturge}
TheExplorer: A map is only useful if you know where you stand.
TheEyeOfTheDragon:
Some powers are far too great even for the
gods of old.
TheFathomlessDepths: Fall into endless night; a voyage into an ocean of oblivion.
TheFeast: Shame what happened to my husband. He had such good taste.
TheFiend:
<size:31>{Your era is now,
your power unwavered, 
soon we will see
who the gods truly favoured.}
TheFletcher: Let these fine arrows pack a punch.
TheFlorasGift:
Sturdy and strong,
grown from the stream.
The Flora that live here,
A combatant's dream.
TheFormlessSea:
Formless might,
Wild beauty tamed,
The brine of gods,
The seas restrained.
TheForsaken: You gave us life and love, more than you could spare. Now you're gone, and we are stranded, alone, cold and without purpose.
TheFox:
"Masters of wit, strength and cunning. To survive the harsh winters, you must be like the fox."
- Ezomyte Proverb
TheGambler: "I don't believe in karma. If it were real, I would never win."
TheGarishPower: Maligaro may have valued function over form, but that did not mute his flair for the dramatic.
TheGemcutter: In the hands of a master craftsman, a worthless pebble can adorn the crown of a king.
TheGentleman: "Axes and mauls are so uncivilised. A good clean cut to the neck with a sharp blade, that's the Sarn way!"
TheGladiator:
The thumb turns down
and the crowd roars, 
they want death 
and the blood is yours.
TheHaleHeart: Though the years weakened his mind, his body remained deadly as ever.
TheHarvester:
<size:30>{Taste not of their
forbidden fruit.
Theirs is a harvest of
the darkest kind,
twisted, rotten and
damned for eternity.}
TheHermit: The hermit's only friend is the greenery he can find.
TheHoarder: "More! I want more!" - Faendris, the Insatiable
TheHunger:
"How many lives have you consumed?" 
"How many times have you blinked?"
TheImmortal:
<size:30>{"Greetings! Just because you think I'm greedy doesn't mean I'm not willing to share. You'll just have to kill me first."
-Grandmaster Dy'Ness}
TheIncantation: When there is no other choice, even the meekest whisper can bring about the greatest storm.
TheInnocent: His brother would not atone, so he took his brother's life, and with it, his sins.
TheInoculated: Chaos spread, wreaking havoc and death. They said none would be spared, and yet here I stand.
TheInsatiable: A lust for souls. The urge to kill just to satisfy its thirst. An unbearable burden that would make even the purest heart blacken over time.
TheInventor:
Jump right in, 
But beware 
Of things broken 
Or beyond compare.
TheIronBard:
<size:24>{Do the simple words used 
alone cause men to cheer? 
One hundred others might 
just as soon make a jeer. 
Perchance it was the turn 
of the tone in this bit. 
See how their hearts shone once, 
by my song, they were lit.}
TheJester:
<size:25>{Summoned for the King's desire,
soon applause came from the court.
However insanity was his only sire,
so the King's reign was cut short.}
TheJewellersBoon: The jeweller's true talent is the capacity to see a jewel's beauty before they draw it out.
TheKingsBlade:
<size:25>{"To know for what you fight. To get up again when you've been struck down. To outmanoeuvre someone faster, trick someone smarter, crush someone stronger. That's what it takes to claim the crown."
- Daresso, the King of Swords}
TheKingsHeart: <size:31>{500 times Kaom's axe fell, 500 times Kaom's Heart splintered. Finally, all that remained was a terrible, heartless Fury.}
TheLastOneStanding: The strongest emerge from suffering. The toughest bear the most scars. The sole survivor claims the greatest of rewards.
TheLich: When the dead raise and master their own, the land is truly lost.
TheLion: <size:31>{The Eternals lauded his valour. The Karui relished his defeat. Yet the final thoughts of Marceus Lioneye were naught but lament for his pride.}
TheLordInBlack:
<size:27>{Thy knee shall bend
in shifting dark,
thy blade shall serve his vigil.
Thy oath shall bind thee
to his mark,
thy flesh shall bear his sigil.}
TheLover: <size:26>{"I wanted to give you three things. I've given you my eternal love. I've sung to you my most beautiful song. I'd have given you the moon last, but it couldn't be found. I hope you'll accept this instead."}
TheLunarisPriestess:
Embrace the Light,
Await the Morrow,
No more Spite,
And no more Sorrow.
TheMaster: In a world filled with chaos, he could always seek comfort in the hands of his master.
TheMayor:
A ruler is only as powerful as he is wealthy. 
Control the coin, control the empire.
TheMercenary: Loyalty can be bought. Just make sure you know who the buyer is.
TheMetalsmithsGift_: <size:31>{A month's work, a year's wages, a foolish shortcut through a Rhoa's nest, and a grieving bride-to-be, who never received her betrothed's great gift.}
TheOath: An oath once made is an oath never broken. Do not delay in keeping it, for I take no pleasure in fools.
TheObscured: Our world, dangerous as it is, is far safer than what lies just beyond our sight.
TheOffering: Eternal beauty has a cost, one which Shavronne was happy to pay with the lives of others.
TheOneWithAll:
<size:26>{Embrace death to honour the lost,
no fear in life no matter the cost. 
With one of all we are, 
and all of one we trust, 
throughout past, present and future... be just.}
TheOpulecent: Wealth can, in fact, buy happiness.
ThePackLeader: Become the leader you were born to be.
ThePact: "On this day I mark the first of many agreements that I will have with this land and its people."
ThePenitent: <size:28>{First, I gave my wealth, and we went hungry. Next, I gave my land, and we were homeless. Then, I gave my family, and I was alone. Last, I gave my eyes, and all I could dream was mine.}
ThePoet:
<size:27>{God had forsaken the land 
And Victario wept.
Corruption consumed the land 
And Victario's tears turned to blood.}
ThePorcupine: The first quill separates the quick learners from the dead.
ThePriceOfProtection:
To protect her mansion, she would cut a deal with anyone. Anything. 

Something answered.
TheProfessor: The academic route to knowledge is wide and well-trodden; but it is the untaught one who scales the mountain.
ThePuzzle: As countless fractures weaken the divide, nightmares seep through from the other side.
TheQueen:
The power of the world, 
lies upon your hands.
TheRabidRhoa:
"Experiment 22A: Rhoas, when deprived of water, secrete a most delightfully potent toxin."
- Maligaro
TheRealm: If you wish to rush into strange places, be prepared to face strange things.
TheRisk: "There is no right or wrong choice, no best or worst. There are only choices and their consequences."
TheRiteOfElements:
<size:29>{A mind as quick as lightning, 
fists as hard as stone, 
a heart that burns with fury, 
and eyes that chill to the bone.}
TheRoadToPower: A beacon on the horizon; a guiding light, a call for help, or a warning to turn back.
TheRuthlessCeinture:
In combat, a warrior must first be resourceful,
and second, decisive.
TheSaintsTreasure: <size:31>{Publicly, he lived a pious and chaste life of poverty. Privately, tithes and tributes made him and his lascivious company very comfortable indeed.}
TheSamuraisEye: At night, when the seas are calm, and the skies dark, he can see it. The formless fiend that took his eye, and fractured his mind.
TheScarredMeadow: The earth offers nourishment, growth and healing. Unless, of course, the sky has other plans.
TheScavenger: Take small pieces of things and then assemble them together
TheScholar: It is with the smallest of words that we find the largest of truths.
TheSephirot: If the path to divinity were simple, we'd all be gods.
TheSigil:
<size:29>{Three men travel
through the gate;
they carry a protective ward.
A faction conspires
against their fate,
but magic unravels the sword.}
TheSiren:
<size:26>{At the beck and call
of The Siren's hand,
winter ravages
the trembling land,
and the weight of ice that binds
will break the strongest of minds.}
TheSoul: "Most people only have one. I'm a bit of a hoarder."
TheSparkAndTheFlame: When sky meets ground the flames can be found, but who has the will to tame them.
TheSpoiledPrince: A boy who grows up with everything learns to appreciate nothing.
TheStandoff: Sometimes your greatest enemy is the only one keeping you breathing.
TheStormcaller:
If you beckon the
Lord of Lightning,
do not be surprised
when you are struck.
TheSummoner: To own a piece of the Nightmare, you must first belong to the Nightmare.
TheSun: <size:31>{Each night, the light dies, and each morning she is born anew, embracing the land in her golden wings.}
TheSurgeon:
"He might be lacking in vision, but his virtuosity is undeniable."
- Malachai, on Maligaro
TheSurveyor: Exploring lands made of flesh and sorrow, we'll reap and plunder like there's no tomorrow.
TheSurvivalist:
A lucky number 
For us all 
To help us through 
The perils told.
TheSwordKingsSalute:
<size:26>{Many were slain by the sword king 
Their blood decorating his ring 
Those who retreated were slaughtered 
Those who fought bravely were honoured}
TheThaumaturgist:
<size:31>{"Mastery of thaumaturgy is like any other pursuit; it requires dedication and sacrifice. Sometimes several sacrifices."
- Shavronne of Umbra}
TheTower: A tower built of the strongest stone is not eternal; a towering intellect is not enlightened.
TheTraitor:
<size:31>{Sometimes an apprentice becomes a master through countless hours of hard work and practice.
Sometimes it happens by force.}
TheTrial: You cannot journey to new lands until you have the courage to leave the safety of home.
TheTwilightMoon: The day is dying, the night is born, the air grows cool, the sky is torn.
TheTyrant:
"Fear controls the masses."
- Laszlo, the Scourge
TheUndaunted:
<size:29>{"Fate was always my nemesis... 
But it didn't stop me then, and it won't stop me now."
- Kjetilbrann, The Undaunted}
TheUndisputed: To create something truly spectacular, you must risk total failure.
TheUnion:
On the 21st of Eterni, 
two become one, 
their light outshines 
the setting sun.
TheValkyrie:
<size:26>{The villain strikes,
the world is torn.
A war begins, a hero is born,
The nemesis sets the sky alight.
A hero's sacrifice
sets everything right.
- Drake's Epitaph}
TheValleyOfSteelBoxes:
"The most valuable treasures should be hidden in plain sight." 
- Ina, Keeper of Goods
TheVast:
<size:30>{Can you hear the siren's calls,
Just beyond the sea?
A voice which hearts
of men enthralls,
I too am hooked to thee.}
TheVisionary: Lioneye looked to the heights of glorious victory. And thus he missed the defeat right under his nose.
TheVoid: Reach into the Void and claim your prize.
TheWarden: <size:31>{Brutus' first innovation as Lord Incarcerator was a weighted chain around every neck so that his prisoners would forever bow to him.}
TheWarlord:
To cure the Goddess,
and break the chains of corruption,
you must shatter the world.
TheWatcher:
<size:31>{Strange eyes on top of spines 
Gaze beyond the veil of time 
Deep down below the mines 
A dream of crimson and of grime}
TheWeb:
<size:30>{A weapon, a shelter, a prison.
The web's purpose changes
with the spider's needs.
A lesson we should
take to heart.}
TheWiltedRose: Though the path to divinity is fraught with peril, hope may bloom from within.
TheWind: <size:33>{Weaving through the cracks, searching for weaknesses, silent, indiscriminate, leaving sorrow in its wake.}
TheWitch:
<size:27>{A wanderer in the wild strives 
Against countless foes he survives 
A fool pursues a quest contrived 
By the gift of the witch, alive.}
TheWolf: <size:29>{The largest beasts cannot be overpowered. The Greatwolf teaches us to use guile, not strength, to probe for the soft flesh and strike deep.}
TheWolfsShadow: "If I fall, we will fall together with my fangs in your throat."
TheWolvenKingsBite: <size:31>{A wolf does not bite his mate as he does his prey, yet both begin with bared teeth. Know who you are, and you will know the meaning of the bite.}
TheWolverine: Claw them from the bottom, you'll be glad that you have got 'em, claw them from the top, you'll never want to stop.
TheWorldEater: Its body knows no limits. Its appetite knows no bounds.
TheWrath: <size:31>{"Daughter of catastrophe, mother of pain. Amongst the filth of Wraeclast, she wanders, and her wrath follows." - Quintoon the Returned}
TheWretched: Necromancers, believe me, are more terrifying than their thralls.
ThiefsTrinketSculptureFlavour: Rubbing the eel's head is said to bring smugglers good fortune.
ThreeFacesInTheDark: For every threat you spy in the shadows, there are two others you don't.
ThreeVoices: The village elders had a curious rule: If you hear three voices scream for aid, flee as fast as you can.
ThunderousSkies: <size:30>{Many that have wielded the power of lightning have said that death by electrocution looks like the victim is more alive than ever before.}
TimeLostRelic: Time cannot wash away that which cannot be forgotten.
Tranquillity: Beware the sudden calm, for it is a sure sign of a storm on the horizon.
TreasureHunter:
"Don't worry, I know what I'm doing."
- Toggo's Last Words
TrialMasterFragment1:
You walk away bloodied and exhausted,
but victorious. You have overcome.
TrialMasterFragment2:
Your broken body lies forgotten,
nourishing only the worms.
TrialMasterFragment3:
Mortals spend their lives wondering which
fate shall be theirs. Chaos takes amusement
in knowing the answer: all of them.
TrialMasterFragment4:
You stagger away, embarrassed by your failure.
Your only consolation prize is your life.
TurnTheOtherCheek:
"Only after one forsakes rage, can true power be found."
- Sekhema Asenath
UberEaterOfWorldsKey:
That which could not be digested
remains lost within, the buried remnants
of whole cultures, of entire worlds.
UberElderFragment1: Beauty is in the eye of the creator.
UberElderFragment4: What is not cannot cause harm.
UberMavenKey:
Champions of her collection may take what
they wish, so long as they use it to entertain her...
UberSearingExarchKey:
Minds are not the only thing
the Cleansing Fire keeps eternal...
UberShaperKey:
Step into the inner sanctum of the minds of old
Enter a realm untouched even by starlight
Through transcendence, bend reality to your will.
UberSirusKey:
There is a place, a state of being,
where all that you love forgets you.
UberVenariusKey:
I have already lost more
than you shall ever possess.
Unique340Reliquary:
Though flesh may decay, and bones turn to dust, the spirit fades not.
Floundering eternal in pools of tranquil dark.
UniqueAmulet1:
You are slow, foolish and ignorant.
I am not.
UniqueAmulet10:
The world is but a piece of parchment, blank and symmetric. 
We label each side: one Good, one Evil; one Black, one White. 
The divine truth, however, is that both are one and the same. 
-Jaetai, Vaal Advisor
UniqueAmulet10x:
"A rare unequivocal success, Prototype #11 causes wounds to heal so quickly
the type Delta test subject actually survived the entire testing regimen."
UniqueAmulet16: Forge your Perseverance on the Anvil of Faith.
UniqueAmulet17:
"Marylene stroked the medallion at her breast 
before every duel and every cast of the die." 
- Victario, the People's Poet
UniqueAmulet2:
The maidens of court swoon to see
the challengers crushed at your feet.
UniqueAmulet20:
As you have lived, so you shall die 
forever trying to keep up with me. 
Your blood on these hands of mine
forever makes me the public enemy.
UniqueAmulet21: The first light to grow in the primordial darkness.
UniqueAmulet22:
A shimmering symbol of Purity, clear as water,
but I know better than most how quickly
Purity can succumb to Corruption.
How quickly water turns to blood.
- Victario, the People's Poet
UniqueAmulet23:
In my dream, a voice spoke to me. It said:
'My reach knows no bounds.
All that is pure is destined to rot.
All that lives is destined to serve.'
- Doryani, Queen's Thaumaturgist
UniqueAmulet24:
Shackled fires dance about;
Might within from force without.
UniqueAmulet25:
Combat is simple.
Keep your blood in.
Take theirs out.
UniqueAmulet26:
When slaughtered flesh falls silent,
the soul may yet scream on.
UniqueAmulet27:
"I offer to you an eternal oath 
that binds your heart to mine;
a bond that not even death will break.
Will you accept?"
- Daresso, to his beloved
UniqueAmulet28:
Those who dwell in the deep freeze
enjoy a special kind of madness.
UniqueAmulet29:
Those who dwell in the deep freeze
enjoy a special kind of madness.
UniqueAmulet29x:
"Researcher Graven spent eleven hours suffering electrocution in the lab
before he was found. Prototype #14 somehow kept him from dying."
UniqueAmulet3: The breath of life is yours to give.
UniqueAmulet30: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod
UniqueAmulet31: Remember the past, anticipate the future.
UniqueAmulet32: Many things come to one who has nothing.
UniqueAmulet33:
Each death witnessed is a valuable lesson, 
and what use is knowledge if it is not put into practice?
UniqueAmulet35:
"...and so He said: 'Let only the good meet my gaze'
and no eye met His. So He called down the cleansing flames
and let black smoke sweep the Sinners away."
- Book of Innocence
UniqueAmulet36:
Friendship worth its weight in gold,
a treasure every day.
I thought together we'd grow old,
until fate pulled you away.
UniqueAmulet38:
We are his blood.
Through us he carries his burning message.
UniqueAmulet4:
It is said to make you invisible when the Great
Spirit comes to take you on your final journey.
UniqueAmulet40:
A single moment sets in motion an eternal fall,
beneath which all are buried.
UniqueAmulet42:
But the fool did not bow.
The fool stood and questioned.
And the fool was unwritten.
UniqueAmulet43: The dreamer stirs, the world trembles.
UniqueAmulet44:
"He does not love. He does not feel regret or remorse.
He does not think about consequences, only possibilities.
If that does not describe a monster, tell me: what does?"
- Archbishop Geofri
UniqueAmulet45:
Though its body was locked in stone,
its essence wandered the infinite,
learning, and preparing.
UniqueAmulet45Uber:
There is no darker void than the hollow
ache of love disremembered...
UniqueAmulet46: Let the unrepentant be dragged ever downwards by the weight of their sins.
UniqueAmulet48:
The seed of life, saved and savoured.

<default>{This item can be transformed on the Altar of Sacrifice along with Vial of Sacrifice}
UniqueAmulet49: We are incapable of change without sacrifice, for we are both the iron and the forge.
UniqueAmulet5:
"Shoot first, ask no questions."
- Karui wisdom
UniqueAmulet50:
"No man, before or since,
has climbed to such lofty heights
or fallen so far."
- Voll, Emperor of Purity
UniqueAmulet51:
The leash of the lifegiver
binds in both directions.
UniqueAmulet52: He was a lot luckier before he lost this.
UniqueAmulet53:
It was not his fearlessness or ferocity, nor his tactical genius,
it was his leadership that earned Aul, the Last King, his crown.
UniqueAmulet54:
Time, like light, can be refracted into all its myriad colours.
The first shade is beautiful, but the last will drive the unwary insane.
UniqueAmulet55: Strike true, strike hard, and leave no survivors to retaliate.
UniqueAmulet55x:
"The type Delta test subjects could have escaped with the power offered by
Prototype #15, but they suddenly chose to murder each other instead..."
UniqueAmulet56:
"Hyrri and her arrows broke the sacred code, damning herself. 
Kaom seized her sacrifice, and in doing so, seized victory." 
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueAmulet57: Greater than any blade, agility and intellect will be your weapons.
UniqueAmulet59: A single act of anger travels countless paths of destruction.
UniqueAmulet5x:
"In testing, Prototype #9 had no effect on fired arrows. However,
an unknown spell did destroy the entire firing chamber."
UniqueAmulet6:
Never blinking, always watching.

<default>{This item can be transformed with a Blessing of Chayula}
UniqueAmulet60_: The storm cannot break that which bends.
UniqueAmulet63: Death creeps closer; unseen, inexorable, hungry.
UniqueAmulet64:
For how little time they had together,
their love was all the more powerful.
UniqueAmulet65:
"Remain poised. Remain balanced. Keep all the emotions of a lifetime caged.
Let only your enemies see the truth of your rage."
UniqueAmulet67:
The time is nigh.
War has come.
We dream as one.
UniqueAmulet68:
That winter, scorched refugees emerged from the shrine,
speaking only in strange tongues. They prayed to a new
symbol of power, not out of love, but out of fear.
UniqueAmulet69:
A single facet contains the wisdom
of countless disintegrated worlds.
UniqueAmulet7: The light that reveals is the glare that blinds.
UniqueAmulet70: Simply the way it must be, so that existence may be.
UniqueAmulet8:
Mindless rage will shake the world,
Cunning lies will bend it.
Reckless haste will break the world,
And into darkness send it.
UniqueAmulet9:
Forged from the blood of countless wars, 
its thirst has only begun.
UniqueAmuletVictor1:
A glimpse of victory
is all you need to win.
UniqueBelt1:
They say a lifetime of wisdom is carried
in every skin the great beasts shed.
UniqueBelt10: Nothing is as vivid as the rage of battle
UniqueBelt10x:
"A legion of forty soldiers attempted to break into Outpost Five and
steal Prototype #659. What do they know that we do not?"
UniqueBelt11: At knifepoint, a moment's hesitation means death.
UniqueBelt11x:
"I cannot fathom the mysteries of Prototype #16. It did nearly nothing until I
brought it to [RESTRICTED]. It makes no sense!"
- Researcher Graven
UniqueBelt12:
"Our genius will pave the way forward.
May all who are worthy be improved!"
- Inquisitor Maligaro
UniqueBelt13:
In battle, virtue matters not. 
Only victory.
UniqueBelt14:
With her cold resolve
And burning sacrifice
The Eternal twins arose.
UniqueBelt15:
Our forefathers danced and drank and ate their fill
and did not honour the First Ones for their gifts.
So the First Ones filled the sky with fire.
UniqueBelt16:
After the Great Fire, the land lay barren
and our forefathers grew weak.
Mother Gull took pity on them
and gave them grain and water.
UniqueBelt17:
But the grain grew twisted and the water turned dark
and those who partook of Mother Gull's gift
birthed monsters that fed 
on the flesh of one another.
UniqueBelt18:
"They say a draught of fine spirits will ward off
the elements and promote a longer, merrier life.
I have found this to be true on all counts." 
- Zerphi of the Vaal
UniqueBelt19:
"The power of rebirth rivals that of immortality."
- Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Item 3
UniqueBelt2:
Few men cast a longer shadow
 than the Great Meginord of the North.
UniqueBelt20:
A single step forward
Snap free from the prison
Reborn into freedom eternal
UniqueBelt21:
Vaal bloodpriests were among the earliest intellectuals on record. 
It was they who found that a newly freed soul would 
desperately cling to any other source of life.
UniqueBelt21x:
"Curious. The test spike penetrated the subject's flesh, but the chest wound
was not as deep as expected. There is something here..."
UniqueBelt22:
"Some blows must be evaded. Some blows must be endured.
The trick is to tell them apart."
- Daresso, the Sword King
UniqueBelt23:
You were always there, by my side,
whether we sat or played.
Our friendship was a joyful ride,
I wish you could have stayed.
UniqueBelt24:
All creatures have the potential for greatness
or unequivocal failure.
UniqueBelt26:
With the patience of a prowling lion,
the Shade watched the Scholar.
UniqueBelt27:
Hold in your hand the darkness
and never will the light blind you.
UniqueBelt28:
What started as a desire to feed
became a desire to learn...
UniqueBelt29:
For the Vaal, the relationship between slave and master
was as intimate and volatile as that of lovers.
UniqueBelt3:
A large enough debt turns even a friend
into an enemy, and the Perandus family
had more debtors than anyone.
UniqueBelt31:
Death is your most important duty.
Face it, or curse your bloodline for all eternity.
UniqueBelt32: Cold winds whirl at the crown of the world.
UniqueBelt33_: Poison the land and they'll have nothing to defend.
UniqueBelt33x:
"Recommend extreme caution on any prototypes that can lead to a chain reaction
of deaths. Lab Twelve has been lost to the flames." 
- Lead Researcher Ksaret
UniqueBelt34: Those who offer up sacrifices to every deity entreat the full favour of none.
UniqueBelt35: Drink, my children, and be strengthened.
UniqueBelt38: Freedom is won only by those who are not free.
UniqueBelt39:
"This will help with the pain.
One for you... and one for me."
- Doctor 'Shaky Hands' Opden
UniqueBelt4:
Kaom's strength was rivaled only by
the great Meginord of the north.
UniqueBelt40: Teach a man to burn, and you'll be warm for the rest of his life.
UniqueBelt41:
The burden falls heaviest not on those that died,
but on those that did not.
UniqueBelt42a: The tortured thinker is made heavier by the weight of his guilt.
UniqueBelt42b_: The cruel thinker finds glee in torture most precise.
UniqueBelt42c: The cowardly thinker's greatest success is simply surviving.
UniqueBelt43_: Rivers of power course through your veins.
UniqueBelt44:
Mortal pleasures can hold back the memories,
but a hollow soul can never be healed.
UniqueBelt6:
The sun's fury, trapped
in pillars of blazing light,
Explodes from its cage.
UniqueBelt7:
"A man's soul rules from a cavern of bone, learns and
judges through flesh-born windows. The heart is meat.
The head is where the Man is."
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueBelt7x:
"A type Delta test subject escaped with Prototype #18. He was last seen
ten times the height of a man and crashing straight through walls."
UniqueBelt8:
"She begged the Earth to spare her Son;
Out of love the Earth agreed.
To the other Elements she did not speak
And out of spite They plotted."
- Berek and the Untamed
UniqueBelt9:
"You can invite them but you can never be 
sure who will come knocking."
- Doryani, Queen's Thaumaturgist
UniqueBeltDemigods1:
The bindings of the victorious
wrap around the throats of the defeated.
UniqueBodyDemigods:
The victorious know only leadership,
the rest only servitude.
UniqueBodyDex1:
Hyrri loosed a barrage of arrows,
tipped with a poisoned hatred
only oppression can ferment.
UniqueBodyDex11:
We share one space,
speak one voice,
act through one body.
A flawless crystal.
Brittle.
UniqueBodyDex11x:
"Test subject battered through the hatch with her bare hands,
forcing us to resort to threatening her children to restore containment."
UniqueBodyDex12:
Feed a beast and it will not hunt.
Protect it and it will not fight.
Ferocity must be learned, not taught.
It is suffering that forges the greatest warriors.
UniqueBodyDex2: I'm hiding, yet everyone knows where I am.
UniqueBodyDex4: To catch an animal, think like an animal.
UniqueBodyDex5:
Forget your kite shield. Just put the biggest man
 in the field between you and the archers.
UniqueBodyDex6:
Shedding away her regal past, 
she forged a new destiny. 
Sacrificing the ephemeral joys of man, 
she embraced the eternal grasp of nature. 
Seizing her one true wish, 
she found peace at last.
UniqueBodyDex7:
"I carry neither food nor drink. I rely on the charity
of my fellow wayfarers. Dead men are generous men."
- Taruk of the Wildmen
UniqueBodyDex8:
Do not hide your flaws, your cracks,
mend them, and display them proudly.
For it is these that set us apart.
UniqueBodyDex9:
Curse their vile Council,
They cast me aside as if I am some bastard child.
If they only knew the power I possess.
UniqueBodyDexInt1:
"...The discomfort shown by the others is amusing, but none
can deny that my work has made quite the splash..."
- Maligaro's Journal
UniqueBodyDexInt10:
The First of the Sky was the Last of the First.
It was he who showed us that our limits are self-imposed,
that what we take for law may just be an illusion.
UniqueBodyDexInt11: There can be no defence against the celestial siblings entropy and time.
UniqueBodyDexInt11x:
"The form of this replica came to me in a troubled dream.
I do not believe we should ever allow it to be used."
- Researcher Arn
UniqueBodyDexInt12:
He may have returned from the frozen southern reaches,
but that doesn't mean he ever truly escaped them.
UniqueBodyDexInt13:
The Oriathans built their empire on naval mobility, which allowed
them to wage war wherever their enemy was weakest.
UniqueBodyDexInt14:
Within each of us exists a being of pure malice,
held back only by the lies we tell ourselves.
UniqueBodyDexInt15: Those that can never die have but one wish.
UniqueBodyDexInt2:
When the throat roars,
As eyes weep,
When the hand grips hard
With trembling fingers,
When belly twists
Yet legs stand strong,
That is the work
Of the Defiant Heart.
UniqueBodyDexInt3:
Use the dead to stave off death,
An armour of bones and rot.
Hanging on with bated breath,
One lapse and all for naught.
UniqueBodyDexInt3x:
"Further research must be done on Prototype #282.
There is power here, if it can be tapped."
UniqueBodyDexInt4:
"Every life is a story.
If you're not writing your own,
you'd better know who's writing it for you!"
- Victario, the People's Poet
UniqueBodyDexInt5: Thin is the line between mechanical genius and magic.
UniqueBodyDexInt6:
Don't hesitate; bring death to all, conclusively and swiftly,
or they will give you the same treatment.
UniqueBodyDexInt7: What mother wouldn't give her life for that of her children?
UniqueBodyDexInt8:
Ask any tracker and they'll tell you:
the most dangerous animals
are the ones who don't bother to hide.
UniqueBodyDexInt9: Look to the darkness for nourishment and you will never go hungry.
UniqueBodyDexInt9x:
"Eyes of black, three by three, staring ever darker into me..."
- Researcher Arn
UniqueBodyInt1:
Shavronne's apparel became ever more extravagant
as her body and soul became ever more corrupted.
UniqueBodyInt10:
The quickest way to understand
your own strengths and weaknesses
is to walk in the skin of another.
UniqueBodyInt11:
Renowned by those distinguished,
Exalted by the few.
He skulks in darkness, 
and watches from beneath the city.
UniqueBodyInt12:
Whiff of cold, tiny spark, faintest flicker in the dark.
Embers swirl, ice takes form, sky exposed - Death's perfect storm.
Frost and thunder, flames shine bright, ruin walks the land tonight.
By your hand they dance and bend, wield them and brook no end.
UniqueBodyInt14:
The Lords are chosen so carefully.
Only they may grace His flesh.
UniqueBodyInt15:
As she was sentenced to death, Doedre was silent.
As she was tied to the stake, Doedre was silent.
As the flames licked away her life, Doedre was silent.
But Wraeclast had not heard the last of her.
UniqueBodyInt16:
He took me by my hand, promised me power beyond compare.
But I did not do it for power.
I did it for love.
And I'd do it again in an instant.
UniqueBodyInt17:
The First of the Night was the first explorer
It was she who first braved night's terrors
and found comfort in silence and solace.
UniqueBodyInt18:
In their crimson nightmare, the Vaal are still sacrificing themselves to her glory and beauty. 
They stab their own hearts and cry out in ecstasy, only to rise again.
UniqueBodyInt19:
Exceptional men and women of strong will can flicker a spark, 
but something much greater is needed to unleash the wildfire of true divine flames.
UniqueBodyInt2: He who sows an ember shall reap an inferno.
UniqueBodyInt20: Imbue the body with stolen spirit, hold the leash tight.
UniqueBodyInt21: Faith springs abundant at the edge of death.
UniqueBodyInt3:
My Soul is your Strength
My Price is your Blood
UniqueBodyInt4:
Despair hums, softly, deadly, in the bones of my enemies. 
Eyes will burn, and souls wither, as they bask in my radiance.
UniqueBodyInt5:
The night of a thousand ribbons
To remember the day of a thousand flames
When Sarn burned
And was born again
UniqueBodyInt7:
The greatest mistakes cause suffering 
long after they have been made
UniqueBodyInt8:
When dead men rise and darkness falls
Only faith can be your walls
Walls of Light, not of brick
Twice as strong and twice as thick
UniqueBodyInt9:
Reap what others have sown
Muster them from their graves
Parade them for your pleasure
Zealots in mortis enslaved
UniqueBodyStr1:
The warrior who
fears will fall.
UniqueBodyStr10:
The First of the Deep was the First of All.
It was He who conquered the waves,
who stood guard as land rose from sea.
UniqueBodyStr11:
The Trickster God turned the very Day and Night against each other.
What hope have you?
UniqueBodyStr12: The giant cares not for the ants.
UniqueBodyStr1x:
"Useless for our purposes, but perhaps we can sell Prototype #5
to an archmage to fund other experiments."
UniqueBodyStr2: It is safer to be feared than to be loved.
UniqueBodyStr3:
Tears of blood, aching heart,
My dear Isildria must depart.
UniqueBodyStr4:
Give me neither havens nor solace;
They are for the weak and frightened.
Instead, light the path to greatness,
So that I may begin my bright pursuit.
UniqueBodyStr5:
Some would question if the risk was worth it.
The rest were already dead.
UniqueBodyStr6:
"The Virtue Gems are a gift from the land, 
our land, and we will not let our gifts
be destroyed by savages."
- Marceus Lioneye
UniqueBodyStr7: The turtle's shell one day becomes its tomb.
UniqueBodyStr8: The pirates of Pondium know that full pockets have a tendency to sink.
UniqueBodyStr9:
"The Council have a great many secrets.
Some are better kept that way, Cospri."
- Mauritius, the Iron Heart
UniqueBodyStrDex1:
There is no safer place
Than the Belly of the Beast
UniqueBodyStrDex2:
"There's nothing like imminent death
to galvanize one's purpose in life."
- Malachai the Soulless.
UniqueBodyStrDex3:
"When your back is against the wall,
And your opponent is bleeding you dry,
There is only one appropriate response:
Unbridled, overwhelming violence."
- Daresso, the Sword King
UniqueBodyStrDex4:
"The Consort of Chaos descended,
swiftly, brutally, artfully, she consumed the living,
leaving naught behind but a Rosemarie bloom,
to celebrate the massacre."
- Blass, explorer, hunter, adventurer
UniqueBodyStrDex5:
The truth lies inside every man, if you dig around. 
Many a confession was found in the bowels of Axiom.
UniqueBodyStrDex6:
Swift and silent.
One strike, one corpse.
UniqueBodyStrDex7: Simple is the life of the bear.
UniqueBodyStrDex8:
The First of the Plains was the First of the Hunt
It was she who showed us that there is honour
in waiting in the shadows and picking your moment.
UniqueBodyStrDex8x:
"Attempt #120: the prototype has finally achieved power similar to the original
without breaking all the bones of the test subject. A rousing success."
UniqueBodyStrDexInt1:
"When you have nothing to hide,
you have nothing to fear."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
UniqueBodyStrDexInt2:
Destined for sacrifice,
they were dressed in garments
that blurred the lines between this world
and the next.
UniqueBodyStrInt1:
Although a great leader during the war,
Voll proved disastrous in times of peace.
UniqueBodyStrInt10:
A general may carry his men to greatness, 
or be dragged beneath the mire by their burden.
UniqueBodyStrInt11: A glacier of putrid meat, crushing mountains and valleys alike.
UniqueBodyStrInt13: The mind is a filter through which anarchy becomes order.
UniqueBodyStrInt14:
"This was the first step in some grand design, 
lost to the ages, now ours to decipher." 
- Dominus, High Templar
UniqueBodyStrInt2: Nothing stops the pain like a courageous rush into battle.
UniqueBodyStrInt2x:
"Prototype #7 achieved even greater injury responsiveness than expected,
though at considerable cost to the long-term survival rate of the user."
UniqueBodyStrInt3:
When Solaris closes her burning eye
At the end of time,
the world will perish in ice.
UniqueBodyStrInt4:
. . . and the Light faded and hope waned
Zahndethus cast aside his faith
and embraced the darkness.
UniqueBodyStrInt5:
Only light may banish the shadows from this land
And the black lies wrapped around your heart
UniqueBodyStrInt6: The toughest armour is the trust of your people.
UniqueBodyStrInt7:
Faith does not make us invulnerable.
It makes us immortal.
UniqueBodyStrInt8:
Fragile is the vessel that holds the soul.
Wrap it in cloth, seal it tight.
For once the seal is broken, the contents are lost forever.
UniqueBodyStrInt9:
When it comes to finding a use for surplus,
a rich man has within himself
boundless creativity.
UniqueBodyStrInt9x:
"Better... stronger... more vital... and then... failure. Always, failure.
What key fundamental secret are we missing?"
UniqueBootsAtlas1: Nothing spreads as quickly as an idea.
UniqueBootsDIY:
"Every day we choose safety or knowledge. 
Live and stagnate, or risk death for truth.
I would rather see the end of the Vaal
than help it tread water." 
- Doryani, Queen's Thaumaturgist
UniqueBootsDemigods1: Victory is on the march and nothing can stop it.
UniqueBootsDemigods2: Those who burn for victory burn for eternity.
UniqueBootsDex1: Do not let them step on your feet. Keep them at bay.
UniqueBootsDex10:
The Goat King knew not of war,
of the lands and laws he trampled.
The Goat King knew only joy
at turning life to ash.
UniqueBootsDex11: The higher you soar, the further you must fall.
UniqueBootsDex13:
A secret is a weapon your enemies do not have.
When the First of the Plains hunted, she moved in silence and acted quickly.
To do otherwise is to arm your foes.
UniqueBootsDex14:
The High Priests ensured the loyalty of their slaves by habituating
them to narcotic stimulants with lethal withdrawals.
UniqueBootsDex2: The wyrm draws warmth from the fires of desire.
UniqueBootsDex3:
Alive but not unscathed, Victario fled
as slaughter blossomed at the gates.
UniqueBootsDex4:
"Sharks thrash and swirl 
To the pounding drum of their frenzied hearts
As they dance in the waters red."
-Lavianga, Guardian of the Karui Way
UniqueBootsDex5:
"Death can be outrun with these, but beware!
In running from death, you may forget to live."
- Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Item 202
UniqueBootsDex7:
"Those who dance are considered insane 
by those who cannot hear the music."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
UniqueBootsDex8: It takes a clear mind to outrun a storm.
UniqueBootsDex9:
Move in with haste.
Strike quick, strike hard.
Vanish like smoke in the wind.
UniqueBootsDex9x:
"The test subject nearly escaped, but the poison gas
system in the hallway functioned as expected."
UniqueBootsDexInt1:
Blazing body, shining bold.
Dance beneath the orb of gold!
UniqueBootsDexInt10:
Relentlessness. Nothing more, nothing less.

<default>{This item can be anointed by Cassia}
UniqueBootsDexInt11:
Every glorious conquest
stands astride innocent bones.
UniqueBootsDexInt12:
A multitude of beings share a wretched existence
irrevocably bound together in perpetual torture.
UniqueBootsDexInt2:
"Bored gods won't give you any favours."
- Maraketh proverb
UniqueBootsDexInt4:
Those Theopolis fatcats put a price on our heads.
Let's see what they'll pay for their own.
UniqueBootsDexInt5:
Step into the void
and experience true freedom.
UniqueBootsDexInt5x:
"Test subject was able to walk into the walls of his chamber after breaking a rabbit's neck.
He was not fast enough, however. Suggest we begin excavation to retrieve prototype."
UniqueBootsDexInt6: Even the dead serve the Lightless.
UniqueBootsDexInt7:
When the fires spilled out of the mountain, The First of the Night wove a net
and was carried into the night on its hot winds.
Though we cannot live without danger, we can learn to live with it.
UniqueBootsDexInt8:
Facing their death,
the mind of a sacrifice
retreats into instinct and madness.

<default>{This item can be transformed on the Altar of Sacrifice along with Vial of the Ritual}
UniqueBootsDexInt8Royale:
Facing their death,
the mind of a sacrifice
retreats into instinct and madness.
UniqueBootsDexInt9:
Only a fool seeks meaning
in a life so fleeting.
UniqueBootsExpedition1:
In their hour of desperate need, the Knights of the Sun
called out for aid... and the Black Scythe answered.
UniqueBootsExpedition2:
Where others would retreat when vulnerable,
Olroth the Gallant fought deeper into battle.
UniqueBootsInt2: All the world is my home.
UniqueBootsInt3:
Shavronne raced to Brutus' side,
her last hope against the Karui tide.
UniqueBootsInt4:
The dead man walks where
the living fear to tread.
UniqueBootsInt4x:
"Outpost Twelve has been abandoned. On the bright side, I expect the plague of apparitions
to serve as ample defence for the relics we left behind." 
- Administrator Qotra
UniqueBootsInt5:
"They say that you should take life's troubles in your stride.
Some men have a longer stride than others."
- Gaius Sentari
UniqueBootsInt6:
To fight an enemy on their lands is a tactical mistake. 
Make those lands your own, and the mistake becomes theirs.
UniqueBootsInt7:
The quick die young, the brilliant go mad,
and the powerful stand alone in a wasteland of their own creation.
UniqueBootsInt8:
Though the path we walk is the same,
each journey is different.
UniqueBootsInt8x:
"Prototype #56 was deemed safe, but judging by Administrator Qotra's new hustle
and improved ability to micromanage us, I'm not so sure." 
- Researcher Graven
UniqueBootsStr1:
The mocking wind, a shielding spell,
The haunting screams, a maddening hell.
UniqueBootsStr10:
When the land rose above the sea, The First of the Deep did not move.
When the sky turned to fire, The First of the Deep did not perish.
We must remember our place, and play to our strengths.
UniqueBootsStr11:
Centuries ago, there existed a unique grove imbued with ancestral fire.
As with all things, the Karui used its wood for war.
UniqueBootsStr2: Don't flinch. It's a waste of good hitting time.
UniqueBootsStr3:
Our home was swallowed beneath 
the great mountain for our complacency. 
Now we must prove our value to the Molten One 
by sating his hunger for life.
UniqueBootsStr5: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod
UniqueBootsStr6:
We move to be closer to her, but the distance yet grows.

<default>{This item can be transformed with a Blessing of Uul-Netol}
UniqueBootsStr7:
We leave a trail, that we may know
where never we will return.
UniqueBootsStr7x:
"Researchers will please refrain from combining our prototypes with existing relics
of power. The temptation is obvious, but the results can be... unpredictable." 
- Administrator Qotra
UniqueBootsStr9: Like lightning, the Ezomyte cavalry need never strike twice.
UniqueBootsStrDex1:
Stand and lead the righteous pride,
Fight till death, never hide.
UniqueBootsStrDex1x:
"Twelve dead, and the seventh lab cannot be entered for several years.
Prototype #12 is a 'success,' if we can ever reach it."
UniqueBootsStrDex2:
"Sirrius flew on wings of light, faster than wind, faster
than thought. But try as he might to outrun the darkness,
it was there, at every turn, waiting for him."
- Azmerian legend
UniqueBootsStrDex3:
"A lick of shadow may ease 
the petty frictions of one's life."
- Inquisitor Maligaro
UniqueBootsStrDex4:
The cursed ghosts march forever,
On their hopeless last endeavour.
UniqueBootsStrDex5:
Corruption sweeps across this land,
but our bloodline is clear.
It is our duty to keep it so.
UniqueBootsStrDex6:
A bird, too heavily laden, cannot take flight.
The First of the Sky teaches us to put aside our possessions
so that we may live more freely.
UniqueBootsStrDex7:
All that was loved, all that was hated -
naught remains but ash.
UniqueBootsStrDex8: Pray that the flames find fascination, for the true end follows when the great eye closes.
UniqueBootsStrInt1:
Tempest's power given form,
Flee before the walking storm.
UniqueBootsStrInt2:
Alberon walked among the accursed,
and they welcomed him.
UniqueBootsStrInt2x:
"Starving test subject became completely incapable of exerting force.
However, after being fed, he began to poison everything he touched..."
UniqueBootsStrInt3: Become one with the unstoppable flame.
UniqueBootsStrInt4:
To extend your life as long as possible
is to extend all the maladies that come with it.
UniqueBootsStrInt5:
For the immortal, what is the difference
between an age and an instant?
UniqueBootsStrInt6: When the time comes to face evil, the faithful are never alone.
UniqueBow1:
"See without doubt, slay without hesitation."
- Marceus Lioneye of Sarn
UniqueBow10:
The eldritch storm descended upon us, and bruised lightning
rained down. Metal withered and flesh melted before its
arcane power. There was no escape, no shelter. Only despair.
UniqueBow11:
"Toasted or frozen
Or twitching in the light
I'm not fussy
And neither is Death."
- Koralus Doomfletch
UniqueBow12: The hunt continues when the prey falls.
UniqueBow13:
"Exiled to the sea; what a joke. 
I'm more free than I've ever been."
- Captain Weylam "Rot-tooth" Roth of the Black Crest
UniqueBow14:
The Eternals commanded an army that need not eat, sleep, or breathe
without the usual depravities of necromancy.
UniqueBow14x:
"Admittedly lacking the finesse of the fabled original,
Prototype #4 achieved identical results through brute force alone."
UniqueBow15:
Night's frost becomes morning's dew
Darkness cleansed, pure and new.
UniqueBow16: We stand together. We strike together.
UniqueBow17: A hundred blind heads, each seeking the taste of prey on the air.
UniqueBow18:
Upon the red pyre we are born.

<default>{This item can be transformed with a Blessing of Xoph}
UniqueBow19: Upon the grey winds his love spreads.
UniqueBow2:
"The wild takes care of its own."
- Hyrri of the Karui
UniqueBow20:
Through droughts, fires, floods and frost,
the ancient giants stand resolute,
while deep in the rich, dark earth,
their grasp stretches ever farther.
UniqueBow21:
Their last thoughts were not of their friends,
or their families, or their homes.
Their last thoughts were untethered from reality,
and bathed in fear and ferocity.
UniqueBow22:
"There were no survivors. It had only been fired twice."
- Order of the Djinn inscription
UniqueBow23:
To eat, to feast, to forget the horror of endless agonising existence
if but for a moment... only to disgorge and do it all again...
UniqueBow3:
The mournful music of the strings,
The creaking arch, the arrow sings.
A choking cry, a rattled breath,
The Reaper's Song, the Harp of Death.
UniqueBow4:
"The rain of a thousand quills that whittle
present into past, life into death."
- Rigwald of the Ezomytes
UniqueBow4x:
"How did you manage to lodge arrows in every single test subject
and researcher in Lab Three simultaneously?" 
- Doctor Bircus
UniqueBow5:
"The Spirit of War knows nothing of good and evil.
It knows only destruction."
- Sekhema Asenath
UniqueBow6:
As a soldier you want to get close to enemy archers.
That is not the case when fighting the Maraketh.
UniqueBow7:
Mark us with mercy, then press on with care,
Execute us steadily, notch away at our despair.
UniqueBow7x:
"How did you manage to lodge arrows in every single test subject
and researcher in Lab Three simultaneously... again?" 
- Doctor Bircus
UniqueBow8:
Centuries of development in steel armoursmithing
turned the armies of the Eternal Empire
into very effective lightning rods.
UniqueBow9: It hunts; as silent as falling snow, as deadly as the tempest.
UniqueBow9x:
"Beware. Prototype #91 is haunted by a strange miasma,
an odour of evil. Nothing can shield the senses." 
- Researcher Arn
UniqueChest1:
"Political power is an illusion.
Popular power is fickle.
Financial power is real and loyal."
- Cadiro Perandus, Lord of the Coin
UniqueChest10:
A captain's first love is his ship. 
They either die together,
or forever linger apart.
UniqueChest13: From those who are gone, to those who remain.
UniqueChest14: Whispers and promises, ancient and alluring.
UniqueChest2:
"Treasure that which the Ancestors have gifted you.
For it can be gone between one breath and the next."
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueChest3:
"A fool steps into the unknown.
An explorer finds his way back again."
- Malachai, Thaumaturge Laureate
UniqueChest4:
What is stronger, the stone or the wind?
Look to the east. Do you see a single stone still standing amongst the dunes?
- Sekhema Deshret
UniqueChest5:
An era so ingrained with decadence, greed and cruelty
that even the graves of murderers were gilded.
UniqueChest6:
Little makes it across the dry plains 
to the foot of the mountain alive.
The mountain dwellers ensure nothing reaches the top.
UniqueChest7:
The caustic fumes that rise from the caldera
kill nearly everything downwind eventually.
The Redblade, however, just go mad.
UniqueChest8:
For generations, the gentle Pondium tides
sheltered the smugglers, murderers and thieves,
and let their resentment and population flourish.
UniqueChest9:
As if pulled by divine strings,
the powerful are drawn to the powerful,
breaking any morals and laws that might stand in the way.
UniqueChestBarrel1:
Just an ordinary barrel, used to store sensible objects. 
Not swarms of things.
UniqueChestGrandmaster1:
The champions rest now, free from pain,
Their souls ascend to the sun.
Some parting gifts are all that remain,
Their eternal vigil is done.
UniqueChestMap9:
The objects Oba valued more than his life,
sealed from the corruption that ultimately took it.
UniqueClassicMap1:
Whispered memory,
A shimmer in the darkness.
Forgotten no more.
UniqueClaw1:
The darkest clouds clashed and coupled,
giving birth to four lightning children of hate.
UniqueClaw10:
What drives us to kill, to carve and to shred?
What drives us to drink the seething souls of the dead?
What drives us to love and to hold, but still go amiss?
What drives us to leave this world for the Abyss?
UniqueClaw10x:
"Test subject was able to survive the entire process simply by shouting epithets at
the researcher. Researcher's feelings were slightly injured." 
- Researcher Graven
UniqueClaw13:
Terror doesn't make you jump.
Terror makes you run.
UniqueClaw14:
Grip the frozen steel, feel it numb you.
Wield the cold touch of death like 
a splinter of your own shattered heart.
UniqueClaw15:
With increasing mastery over death
comes an increasing desire for it.
UniqueClaw16Royale:
She carries us and nurtures us
until we must feed upon each other.
UniqueClaw17:
She thinks and we act.
She acts and we think.
Fragments of the whole that washes clean the skies.
UniqueClaw18:
To discover how cruel nature can be,
you need only shake the wrong branch.
UniqueClaw19: The strong survive. The strongest thrive.
UniqueClaw2:
Fear blisters the heart and thins the blood.
Fear squeezes lungs and sets the guts to fester.
Fear is the wound left untended.
UniqueClaw3:
"For the life of the flesh will always be in the blood."
- Atalui, Vaal Priestess
UniqueClaw4x_:
"An absurdly vicious weapon in the hands of our test subjects. It seems to
channel the desperate will to live. Intriguing." 
- Researcher Olesya
UniqueClaw5:
It's cold and dark where the leviathan sleeps.
Colder and darker than death.
- Old Sailor's saying
UniqueClaw6_:
"When the hyena howls thrice
death is sure to follow."
-Maraketh Wisdom
UniqueClaw7:
Tread lightly, lest their vigil find you.
Speak softly, lest their reason fend you.
Cut gently, lest their spirit haunt you.
UniqueClaw8: To the Maraketh, death is as intimate as love.
UniqueClaw9:
There are two things to know about fighting:
When to swing like crazy, and when to run.
UniqueCorruptedJewel1: The hotter something burns, the less is left at the end.
UniqueCorruptedJewel11:
There is no price you can give eternal life
that some would not pay.
UniqueCorruptedJewel12: Nothing is immune to the Nightmare's twisted influence.
UniqueCorruptedJewel14: Power always comes with a price.
UniqueCorruptedJewel14x:
"You know what to do with this, don't you?" - Researcher Graven
"Kill test subjects for their vitality?" - Researcher Olesya
"That is not what he meant." - Researcher Arn
UniqueCorruptedJewel15: Walls built in a hurry fall in a hurry.
UniqueCorruptedJewel2: Ill will is the greatest of burdens.
UniqueCorruptedJewel3: In sickness, the insane becomes sane.
UniqueCorruptedJewel4:
The Vaal used human sacrifice to power their empire.
They, too, eventually sought means to 
make their machines run more efficiently.
UniqueCorruptedJewel5:
Atziri went to great lengths to ensure her immortality,
but nothing is eternal.
UniqueCorruptedJewel6:
In their final days, every crime was punishable by death.
Atziri's empire ran on blood, but the blood was running dry.
UniqueCorruptedJewel7:
Even a millennium later, Atziri's presence
casts a shroud over Wraeclast.
UniqueCorruptedJewel8:
"The Vaal left a thousand warnings behind.
We ignored every single one."
- Siosa, the Last Scholar
UniqueCorruptedJewel9:
Few living things survived the cleansing flames.
Those that did thrived... 
And changed...
UniqueDagger1:
Divine intervention feels better
when you do it yourself.
UniqueDagger10: The brightest flames cast the darkest shadows.
UniqueDagger11:
A tap on the shoulder
A peck on the cheek
A sip of your wine
So red and so sleek
UniqueDagger12:
"I'm a painter, and crimson is my chosen hue."
- Coralito, Brotherhood of Silence
UniqueDagger12x:
"Prototype #131 must never be allowed near anyone who bears a wound, no
matter how slight. Even a tiny cut makes it exponentially more dangerous."
UniqueDagger13:
Love only death
For she shall never let you go.
UniqueDagger14: Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit, sed do eiusmod
UniqueDagger16: Some things must die so that others can live.
UniqueDagger17:
The Maraketh fear very little, 
but they dare not whisper the name
of the demon that flies on Winter's gales.
UniqueDagger18:
Lava bled from the earth and,
after a time, cooled and hardened.
The world protecting its beating heart 
with a thick, black scab.
UniqueDagger19: There is nothing more brutal than a simple blade wielded with rage.
UniqueDagger19x:
"Researchers will refrain from scaring each other by firing ice spears while holding
Prototype #141. Sooner or later, someone's going to lose an eye." 
- Administrator Qotra
UniqueDagger2: A mighty beast, a lavish feast.
UniqueDagger20:
The shadow warrior moves like the wind;
his strikes land long after he is gone.
UniqueDagger21:
"That bronze girl sure knows how to cut someone down to size!"
– Bertrand the Plush
UniqueDagger3:
Unwieldy and garish became graceful
and deadly in Ungil's nimble hands.
UniqueDagger3x:
"Recommend further production of Prototype #122. It makes
an ideal weapon for our suppression troops and guards."
UniqueDagger4:
A heart can be stabbed by thoughts, 
If your mind is sharp enough.
UniqueDagger4x:
"There is something incredibly satisfying about impaling test
subjects with Ethereal Knives. Perhaps it is the sound -
the spell, the screams, or both."  - Researcher Olesya
UniqueDagger5:
Maligaro considered his work an Art, 
and his subjects his canvas.
UniqueDagger6:
A fang of hellfire, chip of frost,
Lightning flickers, blade embossed.
With dagger clenched, into the fray!
Or draw it out, and cast away.
UniqueDagger7: Unnatural Origins, unnatural benefits, unnatural cost.
UniqueDagger8:
Calling it poison would imply
that it was even edible.
UniqueDagger9:
Nothing is pure.
Slice open the Innocent
And spill a thousand Sins.

Into darkness, horror, madness...
So goes the descent.

Into darkness, horror, madness...
So goes the descent.

Into darkness, horror, madness...

UniqueDexHelmet1:
Fairgraves' trusty tricorne accompanied him far across
the seas, deep under the ground, and even beyond death.
UniqueDexHelmet2:
Give of your heated passions.
Give of your cold resolve.
You will be repaid.
UniqueFishingRod1:
Give a man a fish, and you can feed him for a day.
But give a fish a man, and you can feed it for a month.
UniqueFishingRod2:
He cast far into the ocean
And tore out her heart.
UniqueFlask1:
Knowledge is fermented in pain and loss
Distilled with reflection
To quench the thirst of those
who dream of enlightenment
UniqueFlask10:
Let blood sear in your veins, 
Let the pain push outwards and turn away your enemy's blows.
UniqueFlask11: The great city of storms, washed away by Vinktar's thirst for power.
UniqueFlask12: Rancid, rotten, and wicked are those that dare to taste my serum.
UniqueFlask13:
To achieve godhood, they would cast off all that god has gifted us.
Mortality, compassion, even the sanctity of flesh.
 - High Templar Voll
UniqueFlask14: Between a rock and a rock.
UniqueFlask15x:
"Success! Prototype #54 has tapped into that sliver of divinity that exists within.
Faith fuels the flesh, and the flesh fuels the fire..."
UniqueFlask16:
"Proof that if you devote yourself to a god of death,
you may be spared from its wrath."
- Icius Perandus, Antiquities Collection, Item 408
UniqueFlask18:
Travelers of the deep wood speak of a witch
whose ale provides a different kind
of liquid courage.
UniqueFlask19:
"Think of those that cursed us, judged us, 
and burned our sisters upon the pyre. 
Think of their names as you drink, 
and even their children will feel what we do to them today." 
-Vadinya, to her coven
UniqueFlask2:
Doedre Darktongue knew the Way of the Thaumaturge.
In order to receive, one must give... without hesitation.
UniqueFlask20:
All things must die.
Whether you burn out or explode is up to you.
UniqueFlask21:
And from the ashes he rose, like a black cloud.
The Sin of one became the Sin of many.
UniqueFlask22:
The summer sun dries the soil and burns the leaves.
The autumn rain extinguishes the flames.
The spring bloom shades the wet earth.
Nature is an eternal tug of war.
UniqueFlask23:
"What cruelty it is, that to be judged a success,
such great work must go uncredited." 
- Coralito, Brotherhood of Silence
UniqueFlask24: Dance like dust on the desert wind.
UniqueFlask25:
Freedom is for the privileged, even in death.

<default>{This item can be transformed on the Altar of Sacrifice along with Vial of the Ghost}
UniqueFlask26:
"What care have I for their pain? They're already dead."
- Atalui, Vaal Priestess
UniqueFlask27: A controlled burn is sometimes necessary for new life.
UniqueFlask28: A tourniquet for the soul, squeezing ethereal into physical.
UniqueFlask29:
Olroth the Gallant,
tireless and true,
he fights for me,
he fights for you!
UniqueFlask3:
"Kaom fought and killed for his people.
Kaom bled for his people.
And so the people gave, the people bled,
So their King might go on."
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueFlask30:
Uhtred and his priests drank of the skies
to empower runes... and themselves.
UniqueFlask31_:
Nothing endures. All things end.
Then, they begin again.
UniqueFlask32:
Vorana trained her mercenaries
thus: strike true and survive.
UniqueFlask4:
"When the Ancestors fill your cup,
It is only good manners to drink your fill."
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueFlask5:
"Death needs not your understanding. It needs only your loyalty." 
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
UniqueFlask7:
"Yesterday I was clever, so I wanted to change the world.
Today I am wise, so I am changing myself."
-Rumi of the Vaal
UniqueFlask7x:
"The most terrifying split second of my life." 
- Researcher Graven
UniqueFlask8:
A sip will freeze your lips,
A swig will chill your heart,
A glass will still your soul.
UniqueFlask9:
A sprinkle of hunger, a spoonful of menace
and three generous cups of Might.
UniqueGlovesDemigods1:
Though the battle has been long,
Victory is at hand.
UniqueGlovesDex1:
Of ancient giants, none remain,
Their only trace is timeless pain.
UniqueGlovesDex2:
Maligaro operated effortlessly,
with great speed and terrible consequences.
UniqueGlovesDex3:
The fury of the forge determines
the ferocity of the metal.
UniqueGlovesDex4:
Land and sea did not dissuade,
nor did the Kelpie's maw;
the wild beast crossed half the world
to sate his hungry claw.
UniqueGlovesDex5: Lay bare paths to pain you never knew you had.
UniqueGlovesDex6:
Under its influence, shards of metal take on a life of their own, wriggling into flesh,
burrowing into organs, and exploding outwards in search of other victims.
UniqueGlovesDex7: The target changes, but the job's always the same.
UniqueGlovesDexInt1:
A single lightning strike fells a man.
A single knife stroke fells an empire.
UniqueGlovesDexInt10:
A burden shared is a burden made lighter.
The First of the Night teaches us that our burdens 
are not just ours to bear, but ours to use against oppressors.
UniqueGlovesDexInt11:
Great works take time.

<default>{This item can be transformed on the Altar of Sacrifice along with Vial of Dominance}
UniqueGlovesDexInt12: A plan without a deadline stays a plan.
UniqueGlovesDexInt13: The power of lightning is a power best shared.
UniqueGlovesDexInt14: The Black Sekhema's trial had only just begun.
UniqueGlovesDexInt15:
Biology is but a machine, begetting effusion of energies;
death is but a curse, that can be given... or reversed.
UniqueGlovesDexInt17:
"We have methods of interrogation the Inquisitors only dream of."
- Marcus, Brotherhood Liaison
UniqueGlovesDexInt18: Fear can be instilled by the smallest entity.
UniqueGlovesDexInt2: Fly like a Storm Crow, crush like a Rhoa
UniqueGlovesDexInt3:
The roar of the heavens
Strikes more than fear
Into the hearts of Man
UniqueGlovesDexInt4:
The cards don't choose life and death
That's up to the player.
UniqueGlovesDexInt5:
"As the serpent shuns thought,
It shuns fear.
It strikes with the speed of wrath
And the skill of compulsion."
- Deshret, The Red Sekhema
UniqueGlovesDexInt6:
What is fear but a snuffed torch
and death in the wind?
UniqueGlovesDexInt7:
"Decomposition takes hold too quickly!
No, if we are to keep the specimen in perfect shape,
we must begin the process before expiry."
UniqueGlovesDexInt8: What man does not wish for immortality?
UniqueGlovesDexInt9:
Reaching nature's limits, 
many sought power in the unnatural.
UniqueGlovesExpedition1:
Those heroes that set foot on Wraeclast found
themselves changing, only subtly at first...
UniqueGlovesExpedition2:
For forty-two nights, the Feller of Heroes challenged
the next greatest warrior to a one-on-one duel.
None could match his might.
UniqueGlovesInt10:
Xibaqua's treachery was met with divine fury.
One by one, the gods reclaimed their flesh,
until all that remained was a droplet of pure light:
The first Vaal.
UniqueGlovesInt11:
He reached for his home one last time, a shining jewel among the stars...
only to watch in horror as it ruptured and shattered under a tide of limbs.
UniqueGlovesInt2:
While Doedre lacked Maligaro's sense of style,
she surpassed her master in pure malevolence.
UniqueGlovesInt3: Cool the head and cool the blade.
UniqueGlovesInt4:
"You shall hang, in blissful agony, on my every note."
- Kalisa, Prima Donna of Sarn
UniqueGlovesInt4x:
"Our superiors were getting anxious for results, and lowered security standards.
A single attempt of a spell with this unexpected power destroyed an entire floor."
UniqueGlovesInt5:
Death is beautiful. Let not the elements
mar it with their clumsy ways.
UniqueGlovesInt7:
Death does not remove you from our grasp.
Death only brings you closer.
UniqueGlovesInt7x:
"I feel altered when Administrator Qotra wears these gloves.
Somehow, I find that disturbing." 
- Researcher Arn
UniqueGlovesInt8:
"Nothing is more natural than competition.
One feasts, another starves.
One blossoms, another withers.
And one cannot catch the golden sunlight
without casting a bitter shadow."
- Cadiro Perandus
UniqueGlovesInt8x:
"There seems to be some innate relationship between the forces of
chaos and cold. Perhaps we should consult an occultist."
UniqueGlovesInt9:
"One coy look. One blown kiss. One word spoken.
One night I wish I'd forget."
UniqueGlovesStr1:
Why cling to your sanity? It offers you nothing.
Surrender to me, and I will grant you everything.
UniqueGlovesStr10:
The first Karui born on the fringes of the Vaal empire
developed a blood fever born of corruption.
UniqueGlovesStr11:
Lost in a sea of limbs and screaming faces, they claw
for any fleeting pleasure which might dull the pain.
UniqueGlovesStr12: Who can tell when whispers are truly from a god?
UniqueGlovesStr2:
Ride with pride,
strike with vengeance,
live with honour.
UniqueGlovesStr3:
"The heart is the herald. 
It will tell me when it is best to strike."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
UniqueGlovesStr3x:
"One of our researchers cut himself on Prototype #2,
and he has not stopped screaming for months..."
UniqueGlovesStr4:
Doryani's ingenuity raised the Vaal Empire
to unprecedented heights. His curiosity
reduced it to ruins and bones.
UniqueGlovesStr5:
"I like my vassals at sword point,
but my enemies as close as the hilt."
- Emperor Chitus
UniqueGlovesStr7:
With unending determination and resolve he destroyed first the gates, 
then the constructs guarding the tomb on the other side.
UniqueGlovesStr8:
The monstrous men of yore used bows too,
theirs were just bigger.
UniqueGlovesStr9:
The stone that stays in the waves soon crumbles to sand.
The First of the Deep teaches us to watch the tides
and choose our moments to move wisely.
UniqueGlovesStrDex1:
A soft caress in dead of night,
that slips about the neck, so tight.
UniqueGlovesStrDex10:
A hungry beast wastes no energy. 
Every strike, no matter how small, must work towards victory.
The First of the Plains teaches us 
that the largest prey can still be whittled away.
UniqueGlovesStrDex11: Open the way to new and dangerous lands.
UniqueGlovesStrDex12_: Is it better to find new lands - or to create them?
UniqueGlovesStrDex13:
The last gasp is not always one's final act.

<default>{This item can be anointed by Cassia}
UniqueGlovesStrDex14:
Try as you like to hide the
blood on your hands.
You'll still know the truth.
UniqueGlovesStrDex2: Wealth is not to be borne lightly.
UniqueGlovesStrDex4:
"The gems are strangely human at times.
They simply love to be held."
- Doryani, First Seer to the Queen
UniqueGlovesStrDex5:
What is greed but trading a mountain of death
for a sliver of life?
UniqueGlovesStrDex6:
Your lies are our strength.
Your threats are our laughter.
Your hate is our infinity
The fire rises!
UniqueGlovesStrDex7:
Those who witness the shimmering scales of the wyrm
know only fear for the rest of their lives.
Fortunately, the rest of their lives
can be measured in seconds.
UniqueGlovesStrDex8:
"A master artist takes his time when he's painting.
Unfortunately, my kind doesn't often have that luxury."
- Coralito, Brotherhood of Silence
UniqueGlovesStrDex9:
"Ever watched a man crush another man's skull?
Hard to feel hope after that."
UniqueGlovesStrInt10: The secret of the elements lies within a square triangle.
UniqueGlovesStrInt11: The laws of the faith do not apply to its leader.
UniqueGlovesStrInt12:
A sacrifice of blood calls forth His vengeance.
Let the righteous become the Hand of God.
UniqueGlovesStrInt2:
What is freedom but a clean slate
in an unclean world?
UniqueGlovesStrInt3:
Far south, the winter crawls under the skin.
Below the snow, adrift wanderers sleep.
UniqueGlovesStrInt4:
"I ask not for understanding,
only for forgiveness
for what I am about to do.
There will be blood on these shackles yet."
- Anonymous carving, Axiom Prison.
UniqueGlovesStrInt5:
By my hand, the inert is given life.
By my hand, that which rots is reborn.
There is nothing that cannot be changed.
Nothing.
UniqueGlovesStrInt6:
You do not cease to be when you die
any more than the caterpillar ceases to be when it cocoons.
Come, let me show you.
UniqueGlovesStrInt6x:
"Prototype #73 is a near perfect opposite of the original. Perhaps our failures
are due to some unknown polarity we have yet to discover."
UniqueGlovesStrInt7:
When the inferno spread across the land,
it was the First of the Sky who singed his feathers
as he brought the flames to a standstill.
UniqueGlovesStrInt9:
"You covet the strength of your peers, mortal?
Perhaps it can be yours, if you are willing to make an offering of their blood..."
- Vaal Myth of the Third Snake
UniqueHeistContract1:
"If Jamanra has been resurrected the way so many other ancient heroes have returned,
then perhaps I can convince him to rise up and unite the Faridun once more!"
UniqueHeistContract2:
"Some of my inventions don't live up to their names, but some work all
too well. Let's hope that the Unbreakable is the former, not the latter."
UniqueHeistContract3:
"A part of me still believes I can convince Nashta to give up her rebellious ways and come home. That part
of me will forever be nine years of age, futilely chasing her as she runs off into the dunes yet again."
UniqueHeistContract4:
"There can be no freedom
while hate still reigns."
UniqueHeistContract5:
"If Admiral Darnaw is stupid enough to send orders to his fleet members 
and not expect us to steal them, then he deserves what's coming to him!"
UniqueHeistContract6:
"The Vox speak in threats.
We will answer them with action."
UniqueHelmStrInt7: Righteous men seek virtue like tame pups seek praise.
UniqueHelmStrInt8: Wicked men chase power like stray dogs chase a rat.
UniqueHelmetDemigods1:
The champion's name echoes through time, 
drowning out the whispers of the defeated.
UniqueHelmetDex10: A moment of calm before the battle can end the war.
UniqueHelmetDex11:
Ancient worshippers of the Greatwolf were overtaken
by a ravenous hunger for all things mystical.
UniqueHelmetDex3: No metal slips as easily through the fingers as gold.
UniqueHelmetDex4:
There was no hero made out of Starkonja's death,
but merely a long sleep made eternal.
UniqueHelmetDex5:
Nature respects the strong
And paints the snow red
With the blood of the weak
UniqueHelmetDex5x:
"Test subject walked right through the poison gas defenses, and attempts to slow her
failed. Suppression troop six, the 'Furious Flagellants,' have been sent to intervene."
UniqueHelmetDex6:
A lad with no fear of the pest 
Let rats fill his helmet in jest 
When they picked his skull clean
Where his head should have been
Was naught but a vermin-filled nest!
UniqueHelmetDex7: If you know where to strike, you need only strike once.
UniqueHelmetDex8:
Though we are individual, we share the same plight.
The First of the Sky teaches us that unity and selflessness,
not division and greed, is what will carry us upwards.
UniqueHelmetDex9:
The villagers seared the blight with cold, but it only bloomed countless spears.

<default>{This item can be anointed by Cassia}
UniqueHelmetDexInt1:
It was a sliver of Malachai's soul
that animated the first Eternal Guardian.
UniqueHelmetDexInt10:
It is a fool who strikes the turtle's shell.
The First of the Plains teaches us to exploit weaknesses,
and where no weakness can be found, to create one.
UniqueHelmetDexInt11:
Sing with me one last duet,
the curtain closes nigh.
Join me in a quiet song,
Before we all must die.
UniqueHelmetDexInt12:
"The more the warrior understood Tangmazu's gift, the less the mask aided him.
His dreams were filled with divine laughter."
- Tenth Song of the Islands
UniqueHelmetDexInt13:
Through vision coloured by burning rage and icy hate
peers a visitor from a realm of ill intent...
UniqueHelmetDexInt15: Obtaining information depends upon pretending one already has it.
UniqueHelmetDexInt16:
Man retains sanity and strives toward civilisation
only under the blessed veil of ignorance.
UniqueHelmetDexInt2: For none of us are as cruel as all of us.
UniqueHelmetDexInt2x:
"Prototype #412 seems to bear much in
common with Thought Extractor technology."
UniqueHelmetDexInt3:
"It is the Gull that delivers Man unto Ancestor.
The consumer of our flesh. The seeder of our
souls unto the earth. We give the Gull his life.
The Gull gives us our Way."
- Lavianga, Advisor to Kaom
UniqueHelmetDexInt4:
"The ice seared his naked feet
As the lightning stilled his heart,
But it was the flames upon his lover's face
That roused him to vengeance."
- From 'The Three Dragons' by Victario of Sarn
UniqueHelmetDexInt5:
"A queen should be seen, admired, but never touched."
- Atziri, Queen of the Vaal
UniqueHelmetDexInt6:
A lightless world
a silent reign
two sightless eyes
feed on your pain.
UniqueHelmetDexInt7:
Branded a heretic for your beliefs,
You stand alone against many.
May the truth that fuels their anger,
Carry your blade into their hearts.
UniqueHelmetDexInt9:
Men always fell for her honeyed eyes,
and broke when they hit the ground.
UniqueHelmetExpedition1: The priests of the Kalguur worshipped knowledge, not gods.
UniqueHelmetExpedition2:
Cadigan the Third ruled dispassionately
through the iron might of artifice.
UniqueHelmetInt10:
An angry god is one thing, 
but you should really fear a god 
with an unpredictable sense of humour.
UniqueHelmetInt11:
You think we do not know.
We know all that you think.
UniqueHelmetInt12:
The impediments of flesh are weak.
The air we breathe knows no such boundaries.
I exhale, and you inhale,
and inexorably we inch towards oneness.
UniqueHelmetInt13:
Countless men proclaimed themselves the masters of death,
and each one succumbed to it.
UniqueHelmetInt14:
Where the body's limits begin,
the mind's limits end.
UniqueHelmetInt15:
Gleeful are the few
who bask in the blood of the many.
UniqueHelmetInt16:
A hunter uses everything at their disposal.
The First of the Night did not hold back her venom. 
She used it to weaken her enemies, 
and used her enemies to strengthen her many children.
UniqueHelmetInt17:
"Feel the pain of ancient wounds.
Feel the doom of dying souls."
UniqueHelmetInt18: See the land as it is.
UniqueHelmetInt19a: See creation as it was, aflame and frantic.
UniqueHelmetInt19b: See creation as it will be, frozen and silent.
UniqueHelmetInt19c: See creation as it is, energetic and storming.
UniqueHelmetInt20: The spirit hungers for the flesh.
UniqueHelmetInt21:
Young Napuatzi was thrown into the pits, an unwilling sacrifice, 
but the offer of her blood was refused. 
She rose from the pit alive and anew.  
A Leader. A Conquerer. A Viper.
UniqueHelmetInt22: The Light drove the darkness from our lands and from our hearts.
UniqueHelmetInt23:
The villagers seared the blight with lightning, but it only forked into countless tendrils.

<default>{This item can be anointed by Cassia}
UniqueHelmetInt24: A dance as old as time.
UniqueHelmetInt25:
